commit_message:
Listen on 127.0.0.1 in devstack

To allow monitoring checks to work, the API should additionally listen
on 127.0.0.1. This changes the devstack plugin so the generated apache
configuration will allow monasca to work without additional tweaking
in a dev environment.

Change-Id: Iaca8eac43d66de5a08e85cf58d7af42c29618bca
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/freezer-api refs/changes/70/340470/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Listen 127.0.0.1:%FREEZER_API_PORT%

commit_message:
Add display-name to freezer-api Apache config

This adds 'display-name=%{GROUP}' to the freezer-api Apache template.
Currently, freezer-api's processes are all named 'httpd' making it
impossible for monitoring tools like monasca to find the correct
processes to watch. By setting 'display-name', the process will be
renamed to the process group ('freezer-api') making it possible to
monitor.

Change-Id: Ia247843d77f9b9148907e1cec80f47fdd394532b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/freezer-api refs/changes/56/340456/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Retry failed disk rescans

Some times, attempting to rescan disks using diskpart fails with
a -2146959352 hresult (error code 8, ERROR_NOT_ENOUGH_MEMORY,
even though there is plenty of RAM available).

Unfortunately, we don't have much information about the reason
this happens, so we'll try to mitigate by adding a few retries.

Change-Id: Ie919fc239840bc057a1cfd78a9825db749bd001b
Closes-Bug: #1569304

commit_message:
Add public method for destroying planned vms

Nova currently leaks planned vms in case of failed live migrations.
For this reason, we'll need to expose the method destroying existing
planned vms.

Partial-Bug: #1604078

Change-Id: I93ae550ec01cf292e1db49c84ec0927e1db1ae2d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-win refs/changes/72/345372/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _destroy_planned_vm(self, planned_vm): vs_man_svc = self._compat_conn.Msvm_VirtualSystemManagementService()[0] def _get_planned_vms(self, conn_v2, vm_name): return conn_v2.Msvm_PlannedComputerSystem(ElementName=vm_name) def destroy_existing_planned_vms(self, vm_name): planned_vms = self._get_planned_vms(self._compat_conn, vm_name) for planned_vm in planned_vms: self._destroy_planned_vm(planned_vm) planned_vms = self._get_planned_vms(conn_v2_remote, vm_name) self.destroy_existing_planned_vms(vm_name)
deleted_lines: def _destroy_planned_vm(self, conn_v2, planned_vm): vs_man_svc = conn_v2.Msvm_VirtualSystemManagementService()[0] def _get_planned_vms(self, conn_v2, vm): return conn_v2.Msvm_PlannedComputerSystem(Name=vm.Name) def _destroy_existing_planned_vms(self, conn_v2, vm): planned_vms = self._get_planned_vms(conn_v2, vm) for planned_vm in planned_vms: self._destroy_planned_vm(conn_v2, planned_vm) planned_vms = self._get_planned_vms(conn_v2_remote, vm) self._destroy_existing_planned_vms(self._compat_conn, vm)

commit_message:
Add strategy name in action plan fields

Command 'actionplan show' will display associated strategy
name of the action plan.

Partially Implements: blueprint efficacy-indicator

Change-Id: Ic1674a53373909bcae06e017fc5e2c53aa8df14a

commit_message:
Add support for OVS DPDK Bridge and Port

Add support in os-net-config for DPDK ports and OVS user bridges,
and implement parameters which will be set by the TripleO Heat
Templates when using TripleO.

Implements: blueprint tripleo-ovs-dpdk

Change-Id: Id4a23ced28b92a642c180a35c55080e5f4e2e05d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-net-config refs/changes/94/338694/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: elif obj_type == "ovs_user_bridge": return OvsUserBridge.from_json(json) elif obj_type == "ovs_dpdk_port": return OvsDpdkPort.from_json(json)class OvsUserBridge(_BaseOpts): """Base class for OVS bridges.""" def __init__(self, name, use_dhcp=False, use_dhcpv6=False, addresses=None, routes=None, mtu=None, members=None, ovs_options=None, ovs_extra=None, nic_mapping=None, persist_mapping=False, defroute=True, dhclient_args=None, dns_servers=None): addresses = addresses or [] routes = routes or [] members = members or [] ovs_extra = ovs_extra or [] dns_servers = dns_servers or [] super(OvsUserBridge, self).__init__(name, use_dhcp, use_dhcpv6, addresses, routes, mtu, False, nic_mapping, persist_mapping, defroute, dhclient_args, dns_servers) self.members = members self.ovs_options = ovs_options self.ovs_extra = ovs_extra for member in self.members: member.bridge_name = name if not isinstance(member, OvsTunnel): member.ovs_port = True if member.primary: if self.primary_interface_name: msg = 'Only one primary interface allowed per bridge.' raise InvalidConfigException(msg) if member.primary_interface_name: self.primary_interface_name = member.primary_interface_name else: self.primary_interface_name = member.name @staticmethod def from_json(json): name = _get_required_field(json, 'name', 'OvsUserBridge') (use_dhcp, use_dhcpv6, addresses, routes, mtu, nic_mapping, persist_mapping, defroute, dhclient_args, dns_servers) = _BaseOpts.base_opts_from_json( json, include_primary=False) ovs_options = json.get('ovs_options') ovs_extra = json.get('ovs_extra', []) members = [] # members members_json = json.get('members') if members_json: if isinstance(members_json, list): for member in members_json: members.append(object_from_json(member)) else: msg = 'Members must be a list.' raise InvalidConfigException(msg) return OvsUserBridge(name, use_dhcp=use_dhcp, use_dhcpv6=use_dhcpv6, addresses=addresses, routes=routes, mtu=mtu, members=members, ovs_options=ovs_options, ovs_extra=ovs_extra, nic_mapping=nic_mapping, persist_mapping=persist_mapping, defroute=defroute, dhclient_args=dhclient_args, dns_servers=dns_servers) class OvsDpdkPort(_BaseOpts): """Base class for OVS Dpdk Ports.""" def __init__(self, name, use_dhcp=False, use_dhcpv6=False, addresses=None, routes=None, mtu=None, primary=False, nic_mapping=None, persist_mapping=False, defroute=True, dhclient_args=None, dns_servers=None, bridge_name=None, ovs_options=None, ovs_extra=None): addresses = addresses or [] routes = routes or [] ovs_extra = ovs_extra or [] dns_servers = dns_servers or [] # Bind the dpdk interface utils.bind_dpdk_interfaces(name) super(OvsDpdkPort, self).__init__(name, use_dhcp, use_dhcpv6, addresses, routes, mtu, primary, nic_mapping, persist_mapping, defroute, dhclient_args, dns_servers) self.bridge_name = bridge_name self.ovs_options = ovs_options or [] self.ovs_extra = ovs_extra or [] @staticmethod def from_json(json): name = _get_required_field(json, 'name', 'OvsDpdkPort') bridge_name = _get_required_field(json, 'bridge_name', 'OvsDpdkPort') ovs_options = json.get('ovs_options', []) ovs_options = ['options:%s' % opt for opt in ovs_options] ovs_extra = json.get('ovs_extra', []) opts = _BaseOpts.base_opts_from_json(json) return OvsDpdkPort(name, *opts, bridge_name=bridge_name, ovs_options=ovs_options, ovs_extra=ovs_extra)

added_lines: "POT-Creation-Date: 2016-08-26 00:09+0000\n""PO-Revision-Date: 2016-08-25 01:28+0000\n""A network protocol that configures devices that are connected to a network " "so that they can communicate on that network by using the Internet Protocol " "(IP). The protocol is implemented in a client-server model where DHCP " "clients request configuration data, such as an IP address, a default route, " "and one or more DNS server addresses from a DHCP server. A method to " "automatically configure networking for a host at boot time. Provided by both " "Networking and Compute." msgstr "" "ネットワークに接続されたデバイスが、そのネットワーク上で IP を使用して通信で" "きるよう、ネットワークデバイスを設定するネットワークプロトコル。このプロトコ" "ルは、クライアントサイドモデルで実装されている。DHCP クライアントは、IP アド" "レス、デフォルトルート、1 つ以上の DNS サーバーアドレス設定データを要求する。" "起動時にホストのネットワーク設定を自動的に行う手段である。 Networking と " "Compute の両サービスで提供されている。" msgid ""msgid "Discretionary Access Control (DAC)" msgstr "任意アクセス制御 (DAC; Discretionary access control)" msgid "" "Governs the ability of subjects to access objects, while enabling users to " "make policy decisions and assign security attributes. The traditional UNIX " "system of users, groups, and read-write-execute permissions is an example of " "DAC." msgstr "" "サブジェクトがオブジェクトにアクセスする機能を統制する。ユーザーがポリシーを" "決定し、セキュリティー属性を割り当てられる。伝統的な UNIX システムのユー" "ザー、グループ、読み書き権限が、DAC の例である。"

subject: Enable health policy to handle CLUSTER_SCALE_IN
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-22 07:43:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/senlin/commit/36dd62f7898ebcb7ff7bb582e865a41fa14ba972', 'message': 'Enable health policy to handle CLUSTER_SCALE_IN

When a CLUSTER_SCALE_IN request comes in, the health policy should be
temporarily disabled so that cluster scaling can be performed properly.

commit_message:
Enable health policy to handle CLUSTER_SCALE_IN

When a CLUSTER_SCALE_IN request comes in, the health policy should be
temporarily disabled so that cluster scaling can be performed properly.
Or else the removed nodes may get recreated automatically.

Change-Id: I9b11517d324b1f1b71db5cdd1bacce9978f68f5f

commit_message:
Remove unnessesary url patterns

Django hasn't ability to catch url links with
request parameters.
Patterns which are deleted by me are unnessesary
and don't influence on common behaviour.

Change-Id: I01b7e0ac176d5619be5d260e5adab580e1338cf0

commit_message:
Fix ci test_check_image_info failed

Now horizon enable the angular image panel by default,
this leads to our dashboard ci test_check_image_info test broken.

This patch using the new xpath for ImageMeta.

Closes-Bug: #1617183
Change-Id: Ib1e8a766d339507a2e17530c2ddaacc14c670b93
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano-dashboard refs/changes/45/360845/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ImageMeta = "//dl//div//[dt[contains(text(), 'murano_image_info')]]/dd"

Composable service to enable DPDK in the compute nodes. It does

  vswitch::ovs when DPDK is enabled by operator
* Configures the required parameters for vswitch::dpdk

Implements: blueprint tripleo-ovs-dpdk

commit_message:
Added a new composable service for enabling DPDK on compute nodes.

ComputeNeutronOvsAgent should be overriden to neutron-ovs-dpdk-agent
service instead of neutron-ovs-agent (default) in order to enable
DPDK in OVS. This new service provides all the required parameters
for enabling DPDK with OVS (vswitch::dpdk).

Implements: blueprint tripleo-ovs-dpdk
Depends-On: I6cfd13d4979731696b09da52b2618fa33042403d

Change-Id: I538043b780a55006c54160cc7b33ddf52684ebf4

commit_message:
Add functional tests for CLI

With more to tempest we'll lose coverage of CLI commands in the gate.
This change adds functional tests covering them in the same way
we cover Python API.

Change-Id: I6356b0b5dfea46c9a8db6479282b60657aede5cf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-ironic-inspector-client refs/changes/64/357864/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import os import sys import tempfilefrom oslo_concurrency import processutilsBASE_CMD = [os.path.join(sys.prefix, 'bin', 'openstack'), '--os-auth-type', 'token_endpoint', '--os-token', 'fake', '--os-url', 'http://127.0.0.1:5050'] class BaseCLITest(functional.Base): def openstack(self, cmd, expect_error=False, parse_json=False): real_cmd = BASE_CMD + cmd if parse_json: real_cmd += ['-f', 'json'] try: out, _err = processutils.execute(*real_cmd) except processutils.ProcessExecutionError as exc: if expect_error: return exc.stderr else: raise else: if expect_error: raise AssertionError('Command %s returned unexpected success' % cmd) elif parse_json: return json.loads(out) else: return out def run_cli(self, *cmd, **kwargs): return self.openstack(['baremetal', 'introspection'] + list(cmd), **kwargs) class TestCLI(BaseCLITest): def test_cli_negative(self): err = self.run_cli('start', expect_error=True) self.assertIn('too few arguments', err) err = self.run_cli('status', expect_error=True) self.assertIn('too few arguments', err) err = self.run_cli('start', 'uuid', '--new-ipmi-username', 'user', expect_error=True) self.assertIn('requires a new password', err) err = self.run_cli('rule', 'show', 'uuid', expect_error=True) self.assertIn('not found', err) err = self.run_cli('rule', 'delete', 'uuid', expect_error=True) self.assertIn('not found', err) def test_introspect_get_status(self): self.run_cli('start', self.uuid) eventlet.greenthread.sleep(functional.DEFAULT_SLEEP) self.cli.node.set_power_state.assert_called_once_with(self.uuid, 'reboot') status = self.run_cli('status', self.uuid, parse_json=True) self.assertEqual({'finished': False, 'error': None}, status) res = self.call_continue(self.data) self.assertEqual({'uuid': self.uuid}, res) eventlet.greenthread.sleep(functional.DEFAULT_SLEEP) self.assertCalledWithPatch(self.patch, self.cli.node.update) self.cli.port.create.assert_called_once_with( node_uuid=self.uuid, address='11:22:33:44:55:66') status = self.run_cli('status', self.uuid, parse_json=True) self.assertEqual({'finished': True, 'error': None}, status) def test_rules_api(self): res = self.run_cli('rule', 'list', parse_json=True) self.assertEqual([], res) rule = {'conditions': [], 'actions': [{'action': 'fail', 'message': 'boom'}], 'description': 'Cool actions', 'uuid': self.uuid} with tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile() as fp: json.dump(rule, fp) fp.flush() res = self.run_cli('rule', 'import', fp.name, parse_json=True) self.assertEqual([{'UUID': self.uuid, 'Description': 'Cool actions'}], res) res = self.run_cli('rule', 'show', self.uuid, parse_json=True) self.assertEqual(rule, res) res = self.run_cli('rule', 'list', parse_json=True) self.assertEqual([{'UUID': self.uuid, 'Description': 'Cool actions'}], res) self.run_cli('rule', 'delete', self.uuid) res = self.run_cli('rule', 'list', parse_json=True) self.assertEqual([], res) with tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile() as fp: rule.pop('uuid') json.dump([rule, rule], fp) fp.flush() res = self.run_cli('rule', 'import', fp.name, parse_json=True) self.run_cli('rule', 'purge') res = self.run_cli('rule', 'list', parse_json=True) self.assertEqual([], res)

Implement first real(not example) unit tests
HTTPClient is deprecated

commit_message:
Add `-k` option to curl call in waitcondition test

This option needed for running test on environments with enabled SSL.
Also change template for this test to make it ready to debug. Now
you have instance with floating ip and outputs with needed urls.

Change-Id: Iaa0f4549586e3c421e3b7fe4573a61e0131d2e9e

added_lines: Puppet::Type.newtype(:connectivity_checker) do desc 'Ping an neighboor host\'s IPs through each existing network' newparam(:name) do desc 'Resource name. fake parameter.' isnamevar end newproperty(:ensure) do newvalues :present, :absent defaultto :present end newparam(:network_scheme) do desc 'Actual network_scheme hash from Hiera' end newparam(:network_metadata) do desc 'Actual network_metadata hash from Hiera' end newparam(:non_destructive) do desc "Define whether we should fail on connectivity issues" newvalues(:true, :yes, :on, :false, :no, :off) aliasvalue(:yes, :true) aliasvalue(:on, :true) aliasvalue(:no, :false) aliasvalue(:off, :false) defaultto :false end newparam(:ping_tries) do desc "How tries to ping should be for success" defaultto 5 validate do |val| if val.to_i <= 0 raise ArgumentError, "ping_tries should be positive integer, not an '#{val}'" end end munge do |val| if val.to_i <= 5 val = 5 end return val.to_i end end newparam(:ping_timeout) do desc "Timeout for each ping call" defaultto 20 validate do |val| if val.to_i <= 0 raise ArgumentError, "ping_timeout should be positive integer, not an '#{val}'" end end end # Up to future usage, check connectivity by huge packets, closest to # interface MTU with noDF flag # # newparam(:use_huge_packets) do # desc "Whether to bring the interface up" # newvalues(:true, :yes, :on, :false, :no, :off) # aliasvalue(:yes, :true) # aliasvalue(:on, :true) # aliasvalue(:no, :false) # aliasvalue(:off, :false) # defaultto :false # end # # newparam(:fix_source_ipaddr) do # desc "Whether the source IP should be fixed up to primary interface ipaddr" # newvalues(:true, :yes, :on, :false, :no, :off) # aliasvalue(:yes, :true) # aliasvalue(:on, :true) # aliasvalue(:no, :false) # aliasvalue(:off, :false) # defaultto :false # end end

commit_message:
Manage db sync command for cell0

Add the ability to sync the cell0 database using nova-manage.
The `db sync` command will be used to sync the cell0 database.
This ensures that operators will only have two db sync commands to
perform in the single cell case.

blueprint cells-cell0

Change-Id: I21ae13a6c029e8ac89484faa212434911160fd51

commit_message:
Create initial infrastructure for fuel-qa refactoring: .core package

Create initial infrastructure:
Create root packages:
  .core
  .core._tests
Checkers (and gates):
  tox.ini: cover env
    requires:
      pytest (this was added to test requirements later)
      pytest-cov
      mock
  /core/pytest.ini
  /.coveragerc
Example changes:
  add collector client as initial target for refactor and testing
  unit tests for HTTPClient (http.py) as example

Blueprint: fuel-qa-join-helpers

Change-Id: I35207eb7bb45ec20d1b61f28be564097420c9f27
(cherry picked from commit 870fb4f)

commit_message:
Rename bay and baymodel

"bay" and "baymodel" is not common term.
This patch rename "bay" to "cluster", and "baymodel" to
"cluster template".

Until "cluster" and "cluster template" is implemented into
Magnum API, Magnum-UI uses bay and baymodel of magnumclient.

Change-Id: I47e0f2437b07492b80426e7105782bd818d99fd5
Implements: blueprint rename-bay-to-cluster

commit_message:
CollectorClient: swith to requests

CollecotrClient: use requests library instead of HTTPClient
Implement first real(not example) unit tests
HTTPClient is deprecated

Change-Id: I3cc1af18d5277c64b4a4426876ac39302af319e3

'}, {'number': 10, 'created': '2016-06-09 22:11:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/1e8a950229339835d2eb6a9f2e94cacf468213fa', 'message': 'DVR: Add exists method to namespace class to check

There is no clear way to distinguish when the snat_namespace
object is initialized and when the actual namespace is created.

Add in an exists method to the namespace object to identify the
existence of the namespace in the given agent.

This would allow us to check for the stale snat namespace and
delete the namespace when the gateway is cleared.

Change-Id: Icb00297208813436c2a9e9a003275462293ad643
Closes-Bug: #1557909
'}, {'number': 11, 'created': '2016-06-10 17:29:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/4ac1eb3b0f0a5809b309f59e664a6fb08cd3220f', 'message': 'DVR: Clean stale snat-ns by checking its existence when agent restarts

At present there is no clear way to distinguish when the snat_namespace
object is initialized and when the actual namespace is created.
There is no way to check if the namespace already existed. The
code was only checking at the snat_namespace object instead of its
existence.

This patch addresses this issue by adding in an exists method to the
namespace object to identify the existence of the namespace in the
given agent.

This would allow us to check for the existence of the namespace,
and also allow us to identify the stale snat namespace and
delete the namespace when the gateway is cleared as the agent restarts.

Change-Id: Icb00297208813436c2a9e9a003275462293ad643
Closes-Bug: #1557909

object is initialized and when the actual namespace is created.

commit_message:
DVR: Clean stale snat-ns by checking its existence when agent restarts

At present there is no clear way to distinguish when the snat_namespace
object is initialized and when the actual namespace is created.
There is no way to check if the namespace already existed. The
code was only checking at the snat_namespace object instead of its
existence.

This patch addresses the issue by adding in an exists method to the
namespace object to identify the existence of the namespace in the
given agent.

This would allow us to check for the existence of the namespace,
and also allow us to identify the stale snat namespace and
delete the namespace when the gateway is cleared as the agent restarts.

This also applies for conditions when the router is manually moved
from one agent to another agent while the agent is dead. When the
agent wakes up it would clean up the stale snat namespace.
Change-Id: Icb00297208813436c2a9e9a003275462293ad643
Closes-Bug: #1557909
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/29/326729/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def exists(self): return self.ip_wrapper_root.netns.exists(self.name)

Use Ironic's generic service name in help messages

Generic service names should be used instead of a specific
implementation name.

commit_message:
Register enabled services via global config

A global settings output was added to all the service types. This is
then added to the hieradata deployed by all-nodes-config. The intent
is to be able to tell which services are deployed globally. So far,
the application is for the APIs, which will be used by both haproxy
and keystone. But more things could be added if needed.

Change-Id: I379932df096c393161c795cae8daf8970168bd90
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/39/359639/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: global_settings: heat_api_cfn_enabled: true

subject: Add "history" mode to versioned_writes middleware
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-20 01:49:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/1370e9df9839c518e72a9565a5516d1d5eda8639', 'message': 'Add delete markers to versioned_writes middleware

Clients may now specify (via a query parameter) the delete-mode to use
when deleting objects from a versioned container. If the client does not
specify a mode, it will be taken from the versioned_writes filter
config, allowing operators to specify a global mode. The following modes
are supported:

 * pop-version

    If no previous versions exist in the versions container, the current
    version is deleted from the versioned container. Otherwise, the
    most-recent previous version from the versions container is copied
    over the current version and that previous version is deleted. This
    is the default and preserves the previous behavior.

 * push-marker

    If a current version exists in the versioned container, it is copied
    to the versions container. Then an empty "delete marker" object is
    put into the versioned container. Subsequent GETs or HEADs will
    return a 404. Subsequent DELETEs will either restore the previous
    version or copy the delete marker to the versions container,
    depending upon delete mode.

Example:
    # Set up containers
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container -X PUT \
        -H 'X-Versions-Location: test_container_versions'
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container_versions -X PUT

    # Create an object
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object -X PUT --data-binary Hello
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 'Hello')

    # Overwrite it
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object -X PUT --data-binary World
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 'World')

    # Delete it, pushing a delete marker
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object?delete-mode=push-marker \
        -X DELETE
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 404)

    # Delete it, popping a version
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object?delete-mode=pop-version \
        -X DELETE
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 'World')

    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object?delete-mode=pop-version \
        -X DELETE
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 'Hello')

    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object?delete-mode=pop-version \
        -X DELETE
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 404)

Change-Id: I555dc17fefd0aa9ade681aa156da24e018ebe74b
DocImpact
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-22 00:21:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/2d916fb15821d8cad5a07d2c2ff74b50440fb007', 'message': 'Add delete markers to versioned_writes middleware

when deleting objects from a versioned container. If the client does not

 * pop-version

    If no previous versions exist in the versions container, the current
    version is deleted from the versioned container. Otherwise, the
    most-recent previous version from the versions container is copied
    over the current version and that previous version is deleted. This
    is the default and preserves the previous behavior.

 * push-marker

    If a current version exists in the versioned container, it is copied
    to the versions container. Then an empty "delete marker" object is
    put into the versioned container. Subsequent GETs or HEADs will
    return a 404. Subsequent DELETEs will either restore the previous
    version or copy the delete marker to the versions container,
    depending upon delete mode.

Example:
    # Set up containers
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container -X PUT \
        -H 'X-Versions-Location: test_container_versions'
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container_versions -X PUT

    # Create an object
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object -X PUT --data-binary Hello
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 'Hello')

    # Overwrite it
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object -X PUT --data-binary World
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 'World')

    # Delete it, pushing a delete marker
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object?delete-mode=push-marker \
        -X DELETE
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 404)

    # Delete it, popping a version
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object?delete-mode=pop-version \
        -X DELETE
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 'World')

    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object?delete-mode=pop-version \
        -X DELETE
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 'Hello')

    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object?delete-mode=pop-version \
        -X DELETE
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 404)

Change-Id: I555dc17fefd0aa9ade681aa156da24e018ebe74b
DocImpact
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2015-09-03 20:30:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/bfb7bcd7e92620ed563f58b9f47801cbe1bc7fb5', 'message': 'Add delete markers to versioned_writes middleware

Clients may now specify (via a query parameter) the delete-mode to use
when deleting objects from a versioned container. If the client does not
specify a mode, it will be taken from the versioned_writes filter
config, allowing operators to specify a global mode. The following modes
are supported:

 * push-marker

    If a current version exists in the versioned container, it is copied
    to the versions container. Then an empty "delete marker" object is
    also put into the versions container; this records when the object
    was deleted. Finally, the original current version is deleted from
    the versioned container. As a result, subsequent GETs or HEADs will
    return a 404, and container listings for the versioned container do
    not include the object.

    With this mode, DELETEs to versioned containers behave like DELETEs
    to other containers, but with a history of what has happened.

 * pop-version

    If no previous versions exist in the versions container, the object
    is deleted. If the most-recent version in the versions container is
    not a delete marker, it is copied into the versioned container
    (overwriting the current version if one exists) and then deleted
    from the versions container. This preserves the previous behavior.

    If the most-recent version in the versions container is a delete
    marker and a current version exists in the versioned container, the
    current version is deleted. If the most-recent version in the
    versions container is a delete marker and no current version exists
    in the versioned container, we copy the next-most-recent version
    from the versions container into the versioned container (assuming
    it exists and is not a delete marker) and delete the most-recent
    version (i.e., the delete marker) from the versions container.

    With this mode, DELETEs to versioned containers "undo" operations
    on containers. Prevoiusly this was limited to undoing PUTs, but now
    it will also undo push-marker DELETEs.

Example:
    # Set up containers
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container -X PUT \
        -H 'X-Versions-Location: test_container_versions'
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container_versions -X PUT

    # Create an object
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object -X PUT --data-binary Hello
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 'Hello')

    # Overwrite it
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object -X PUT --data-binary World
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 'World')

    # Delete it, pushing a delete marker
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object?delete-mode=push-marker \
        -X DELETE
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 404)
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \

'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2015-10-12 16:15:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/a7eeacf2c0e2702d8133dbeacaf54041aa923ff9', 'message': 'Add delete markers to versioned_writes middleware

Clients may now specify (via a query parameter) the delete-mode to use
when deleting objects from a versioned container. If the client does not
specify a mode, it will be taken from the versioned_writes filter
config, allowing operators to specify a global mode. The following modes
are supported:

 * push-marker

    If a current version exists in the versioned container, it is copied
    to the versions container. Then an empty "delete marker" object is
    also put into the versions container; this records when the object
    was deleted. Finally, the original current version is deleted from
    the versioned container. As a result, subsequent GETs or HEADs will
    return a 404, and container listings for the versioned container do
    not include the object.

    With this mode, DELETEs to versioned containers behave like DELETEs
    to other containers, but with a history of what has happened.

 * pop-version

    If no previous versions exist in the versions container, the object
    is deleted. If the most-recent version in the versions container is
    not a delete marker, it is copied into the versioned container
    (overwriting the current version if one exists) and then deleted
    from the versions container. This preserves the previous behavior.

    If the most-recent version in the versions container is a delete
    marker and a current version exists in the versioned container, the
    current version is deleted. If the most-recent version in the
    versions container is a delete marker and no current version exists
    in the versioned container, we copy the next-most-recent version
    from the versions container into the versioned container (assuming
    it exists and is not a delete marker) and delete the most-recent
    version (i.e., the delete marker) from the versions container.

    With this mode, DELETEs to versioned containers "undo" operations
    on containers. Prevoiusly this was limited to undoing PUTs, but now
    it will also undo push-marker DELETEs.

Example:
    # Set up containers
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container -X PUT \
        -H 'X-Versions-Location: test_container_versions'
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container_versions -X PUT

    # Create an object
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object -X PUT --data-binary Hello
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 'Hello')

    # Overwrite it
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object -X PUT --data-binary World
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 'World')

    # Delete it, pushing a delete marker
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object?delete-mode=push-marker \
        -X DELETE
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 404)
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container
    # (does not include 'object')

    # Put another version
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object -X PUT --data-binary Hola
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 'Hola')

    # Overwrite it
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object -X PUT --data-binary Mundo
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 'Mundo')

    # List previous versions
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container_versions
    # (includes versions for 'Hello', 'World', the delete marker, and
    # 'Hola')

    # Delete the object, popping versions
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object?delete-mode=pop-version \
        -X DELETE
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 'Hola')

    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object?delete-mode=pop-version \
        -X DELETE
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 404)
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container
    # (does not include 'object')

    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object?delete-mode=pop-version \
        -X DELETE
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 'World')

    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object?delete-mode=pop-version \
        -X DELETE
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 'Hello')

    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object?delete-mode=pop-version \
        -X DELETE
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \

    # (returns 404)

    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container_versions
    # (no longer contains any previous versions)

'}, {'number': 8, 'created': '2015-12-12 23:10:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/7dd4942059765ea4539bdb0eaa6932fa06778b3c', 'message': 'Add delete markers to versioned_writes middleware

Clients may now specify (via a query parameter) the delete-mode to use
when deleting objects from a versioned container. If the client does not
specify a mode, it will be taken from the versioned_writes filter
config, allowing operators to specify a global mode. The following modes
are supported:

 * push-marker

    If a current version exists in the versioned container, it is copied
    to the versions container. Then an empty "delete marker" object is
    also put into the versions container; this records when the object
    was deleted. Finally, the original current version is deleted from
    the versioned container. As a result, subsequent GETs or HEADs will
    return a 404, and container listings for the versioned container do
    not include the object.

    With this mode, DELETEs to versioned containers behave like DELETEs
    to other containers, but with a history of what has happened.

 * pop-version

    If no previous versions exist in the versions container, the object
    is deleted. If the most-recent version in the versions container is
    not a delete marker, it is copied into the versioned container
    (overwriting the current version if one exists) and then deleted
    from the versions container. This preserves the previous behavior.

    If the most-recent version in the versions container is a delete
    marker and a current version exists in the versioned container, the
    current version is deleted. If the most-recent version in the
    versions container is a delete marker and no current version exists
    in the versioned container, we copy the next-most-recent version
    from the versions container into the versioned container (assuming
    it exists and is not a delete marker) and delete the most-recent
    version (i.e., the delete marker) from the versions container.

    With this mode, DELETEs to versioned containers "undo" operations
    on containers. Prevoiusly this was limited to undoing PUTs, but now
    it will also undo push-marker DELETEs.

Example:
    # Set up containers
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container -X PUT \
        -H 'X-Versions-Location: test_container_versions'
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container_versions -X PUT

    # Create an object
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object -X PUT --data-binary Hello
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 'Hello')

    # Overwrite it
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object -X PUT --data-binary World
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 'World')

    # Delete it, pushing a delete marker
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object?delete-mode=push-marker \
        -X DELETE
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 404)
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container
    # (does not include 'object')

    # Put another version
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object -X PUT --data-binary Hola
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 'Hola')

    # Overwrite it
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object -X PUT --data-binary Mundo
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 'Mundo')

    # List previous versions
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container_versions
    # (includes versions for 'Hello', 'World', the delete marker, and
    # 'Hola')

    # Delete the object, popping versions
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object?delete-mode=pop-version \
        -X DELETE
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 'Hola')

    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object?delete-mode=pop-version \
        -X DELETE
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 404)
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container
    # (does not include 'object')

    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object?delete-mode=pop-version \
        -X DELETE
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 'World')

    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object?delete-mode=pop-version \
        -X DELETE
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 'Hello')

    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object?delete-mode=pop-version \
        -X DELETE
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 404)

    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container_versions
    # (no longer contains any previous versions)

'}, {'number': 11, 'created': '2016-02-17 20:29:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/645780bbfe7c37026f9ad00cbb76af57383298a5', 'message': 'Add "history" mode to versioned_writes middleware

This change introduces the concept of a "versioning mode" for
versioned_writes. The following modes are supported:

 * stack

    When deleting, check whether any previous versions exist in the
    versions container. If none is found, the object is deleted. If the
    most-recent version in the versions container is not a delete
    marker, it is copied into the versioned container (overwriting the
    current version if one exists) and then deleted from the versions
    container. This preserves the previous behavior.

    If the most-recent version in the versions container is a delete
    marker and a current version exists in the versioned container, the
    current version is deleted. If the most-recent version in the
    versions container is a delete marker and no current version exists
    in the versioned container, we copy the next-most-recent version
    from the versions container into the versioned container (assuming
    it exists and is not a delete marker) and delete both the
    most-recent version (i.e., the delete marker) and the just-copied
    next-most-recent version from the versions container.

    With this mode, DELETEs to versioned containers "undo" operations
    on containers. Previously this was limited to undoing PUTs, but now
    it will also undo DELETEs performed while in "history" mode.

 * history

    When deleting, check whether a current version exists in the
    versioned container. If one is found, it is copied to the versions
    container. Then an empty "delete marker" object is also put into the
    versions container; this records when the object was deleted.
    Finally, the original current version is deleted from the versioned
    container. As a result, subsequent GETs or HEADs will return a 404,
    and container listings for the versioned container do not include
    the object.

    With this mode, DELETEs to versioned containers behave like DELETEs
    to other containers, but with a history of what has happened.

Clients may specify (via a new X-Versions-Mode header) which mode a
container should use. By default, the existing "stack" mode is used.

Upgrade consideration:
======================

Clients should not use the "history" mode until all proxies in the
cluster have been upgraded. Attempting to use the "history" mode during
a rolling upgrade may result in some requests being served by proxies
running old code (which necessarily uses the "stack" mode), leading to
data loss.

Example session:
================

    # Set up containers

        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 404)
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container

    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object -X PUT --data-binary Hola
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 'Hola')

    # Overwrite it
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object -X PUT --data-binary Mundo
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object

        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object -X DELETE
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 'Hola')

    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object -X DELETE
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \

    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \

'}, {'number': 12, 'created': '2016-04-07 22:34:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/d5139260488366c099984ef42e0e3d4c7310f331', 'message': 'Add "history" mode to versioned_writes middleware

This change introduces the concept of a "versioning mode" for
versioned_writes. The following modes are supported:

 * stack

    When deleting, check whether any previous versions exist in the
    versions container. If none is found, the object is deleted. If the
    most-recent version in the versions container is not a delete
    marker, it is copied into the versioned container (overwriting the
    current version if one exists) and then deleted from the versions
    container. This preserves the previous behavior.

    If the most-recent version in the versions container is a delete
    marker and a current version exists in the versioned container, the
    current version is deleted. If the most-recent version in the
    versions container is a delete marker and no current version exists
    in the versioned container, we copy the next-most-recent version
    from the versions container into the versioned container (assuming
    it exists and is not a delete marker) and delete both the
    most-recent version (i.e., the delete marker) and the just-copied
    next-most-recent version from the versions container.

    With this mode, DELETEs to versioned containers "undo" operations
    on containers. Previously this was limited to undoing PUTs, but now
    it will also undo DELETEs performed while in "history" mode.

 * history

    When deleting, check whether a current version exists in the
    versioned container. If one is found, it is copied to the versions
    container. Then an empty "delete marker" object is also put into the
    versions container; this records when the object was deleted.
    Finally, the original current version is deleted from the versioned
    container. As a result, subsequent GETs or HEADs will return a 404,
    and container listings for the versioned container do not include
    the object.

    With this mode, DELETEs to versioned containers behave like DELETEs
    to other containers, but with a history of what has happened.

Clients may specify (via a new X-Versions-Mode header) which mode a
container should use. By default, the existing "stack" mode is used.

Upgrade consideration:
======================

Clients should not use the "history" mode until all proxies in the
cluster have been upgraded. Attempting to use the "history" mode during
a rolling upgrade may result in some requests being served by proxies
running old code (which necessarily uses the "stack" mode), leading to
data loss.

Example session:
================

    # Set up containers
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container -X PUT \
        -H 'X-Versions-Location: test_container_versions' \
        -H 'X-Versions-Mode: history'
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container_versions -X PUT

    # Create an object
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object -X PUT --data-binary Hello
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 'Hello')

    # Overwrite it
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object -X PUT --data-binary World
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 'World')

    # Delete it, creating a delete marker
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object -X DELETE
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 404)
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container
    # (does not include 'object')

    # Put another version
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object -X PUT --data-binary Hola
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 'Hola')

    # Overwrite it
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object -X PUT --data-binary Mundo
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 'Mundo')

    # List previous versions
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container_versions
    # (includes versions for 'Hello', 'World', the delete marker, and
    # 'Hola')

    # Toggle the mode, and start popping versions
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container -X POST \

        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object -X DELETE
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \

    # (returns 'Hola')

'}, {'number': 15, 'created': '2016-07-01 16:42:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/cbf077e522d9217ad235b93d6ccb15b3f76aba5b', 'message': 'Add "history" mode to versioned_writes middleware

This change introduces the concept of a "versioning mode" for
versioned_writes. The following modes are supported:

 * stack

    When deleting, check whether any previous versions exist in the
    versions container. If none is found, the object is deleted. If the
    most-recent version in the versions container is not a delete
    marker, it is copied into the versioned container (overwriting the
    current version if one exists) and then deleted from the versions
    container. This preserves the previous behavior.

    If the most-recent version in the versions container is a delete
    marker and a current version exists in the versioned container, the
    current version is deleted. If the most-recent version in the
    versions container is a delete marker and no current version exists
    in the versioned container, we copy the next-most-recent version
    from the versions container into the versioned container (assuming
    it exists and is not a delete marker) and delete both the
    most-recent version (i.e., the delete marker) and the just-copied
    next-most-recent version from the versions container.

    With this mode, DELETEs to versioned containers "undo" operations
    on containers. Previously this was limited to undoing PUTs, but now
    it will also undo DELETEs performed while in "history" mode.

 * history

    When deleting, check whether a current version exists in the
    versioned container. If one is found, it is copied to the versions
    container. Then an empty "delete marker" object is also put into the
    versions container; this records when the object was deleted.
    Finally, the original current version is deleted from the versioned
    container. As a result, subsequent GETs or HEADs will return a 404,
    and container listings for the versioned container do not include
    the object.

    With this mode, DELETEs to versioned containers behave like DELETEs
    to other containers, but with a history of what has happened.

Clients may specify (via a new X-Versions-Mode header) which mode a
container should use. By default, the existing "stack" mode is used.

Upgrade consideration:
======================

Clients should not use the "history" mode until all proxies in the
cluster have been upgraded. Attempting to use the "history" mode during
a rolling upgrade may result in some requests being served by proxies
running old code (which necessarily uses the "stack" mode), leading to
data loss.

Example session:
================

    # Set up containers
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container -X PUT \
        -H 'X-Versions-Location: test_container_versions' \
        -H 'X-Versions-Mode: history'
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container_versions -X PUT

    # Create an object
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object -X PUT --data-binary Hello
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 'Hello')

    # Overwrite it
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object -X PUT --data-binary World
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 'World')

    # Delete it, creating a delete marker
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object -X DELETE
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 404)
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container
    # (does not include 'object')

    # Put another version
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object -X PUT --data-binary Hola
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 'Hola')

    # Overwrite it
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object -X PUT --data-binary Mundo
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 'Mundo')

    # List previous versions
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container_versions
    # (includes versions for 'Hello', 'World', the delete marker, and
    # 'Hola')

    # Toggle the mode, and start popping versions
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container -X POST \
        -H 'X-Versions-Mode: stack'
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object -X DELETE
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 'Hola')

    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object -X DELETE
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 404)
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container
    # (does not include 'object')

    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object -X DELETE
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 'World')

    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object -X DELETE
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 'Hello')

    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object -X DELETE
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 404)

    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container_versions
    # (no longer contains any previous versions)

Change-Id: I555dc17fefd0aa9ade681aa156da24e018ebe74b
DocImpact

'}, {'number': 19, 'created': '2016-08-04 21:07:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/ed948e5065e997b9db22a0cf350b4b6f5dd70760', 'message': 'Add "history" mode to versioned_writes middleware

This change introduces the concept of a "versioning mode" for
versioned_writes. The following modes are supported:

 * stack

    When deleting, check whether any previous versions exist in the
    versions container. If none is found, the object is deleted. If the
    most-recent version in the versions container is not a delete
    marker, it is copied into the versioned container (overwriting the
    current version if one exists) and then deleted from the versions
    container. This preserves the previous behavior.

    If the most-recent version in the versions container is a delete
    marker and a current version exists in the versioned container, the
    current version is deleted. If the most-recent version in the
    versions container is a delete marker and no current version exists
    in the versioned container, we copy the next-most-recent version
    from the versions container into the versioned container (assuming
    it exists and is not a delete marker) and delete both the
    most-recent version (i.e., the delete marker) and the just-copied
    next-most-recent version from the versions container.

    With this mode, DELETEs to versioned containers "undo" operations
    on containers. Previously this was limited to undoing PUTs, but now
    it will also undo DELETEs performed while in "history" mode.

 * history

    When deleting, check whether a current version exists in the
    versioned container. If one is found, it is copied to the versions
    container. Then an empty "delete marker" object is also put into the
    versions container; this records when the object was deleted.
    Finally, the original current version is deleted from the versioned
    container. As a result, subsequent GETs or HEADs will return a 404,
    and container listings for the versioned container do not include
    the object.

    With this mode, DELETEs to versioned containers behave like DELETEs
    to other containers, but with a history of what has happened.

Clients may specify (via a new X-Versions-Mode header) which mode a
container should use. By default, the existing "stack" mode is used.

Upgrade consideration:
======================

Clients should not use the "history" mode until all proxies in the
cluster have been upgraded. Attempting to use the "history" mode during
a rolling upgrade may result in some requests being served by proxies
running old code (which necessarily uses the "stack" mode), leading to
data loss.

Example session:
================

    # Set up containers
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container -X PUT \
        -H 'X-Versions-Location: test_container_versions' \
        -H 'X-Versions-Mode: history'
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container_versions -X PUT

    # Create an object
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object -X PUT --data-binary Hello
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 'Hello')

    # Overwrite it
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object -X PUT --data-binary World
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 'World')

    # Delete it, creating a delete marker
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object -X DELETE
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 404)
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container
    # (does not include 'object')

    # Put another version
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object -X PUT --data-binary Hola
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 'Hola')

    # Overwrite it
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object -X PUT --data-binary Mundo
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object
    # (returns 'Mundo')

    # List previous versions
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container_versions
    # (includes versions for 'Hello', 'World', the delete marker, and
    # 'Hola')

    # Toggle the mode, and start popping versions
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container -X POST \
        -H 'X-Versions-Mode: stack'
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \
        $OS_STORAGE_URL/test_container/object -X DELETE
    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \

    # (returns 'Hola')

    # (returns 404)

    # (does not include 'object')

    $ curl -v -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_AUTH_TOKEN" \

    # (returns 404)

commit_message:
Add "history" mode to versioned_writes middleware

This change introduces the concept of a "versioning mode" for
versioned_writes. The following modes are supported:

 * stack

    When deleting, check whether any previous versions exist in the
    versions container. If none is found, the object is deleted. If the
    most-recent version in the versions container is not a delete
    marker, it is copied into the versioned container (overwriting the
    current version if one exists) and then deleted from the versions
    container. This preserves the previous behavior.

    If the most-recent version in the versions container is a delete
    marker and a current version exists in the versioned container, the
    current version is deleted. If the most-recent version in the
    versions container is a delete marker and no current version exists
    in the versioned container, we copy the next-most-recent version
    from the versions container into the versioned container (assuming
    it exists and is not a delete marker) and delete both the
    most-recent version (i.e., the delete marker) and the just-copied
    next-most-recent version from the versions container.

    With this mode, DELETEs to versioned containers "undo" operations
    on containers. Previously this was limited to undoing PUTs, but now
    it will also undo DELETEs performed while in "history" mode.

 * history

    When deleting, check whether a current version exists in the
    versioned container. If one is found, it is copied to the versions
    container. Then an empty "delete marker" object is also put into the
    versions container; this records when the object was deleted.
    Finally, the original current version is deleted from the versioned
    container. As a result, subsequent GETs or HEADs will return a 404,
    and container listings for the versioned container do not include
    the object.

    With this mode, DELETEs to versioned containers behave like DELETEs
    to other containers, but with a history of what has happened.

Clients may specify (via a new X-Versions-Mode header) which mode a
container should use. By default, the existing "stack" mode is used.

Upgrade consideration:
======================

Clients should not use the "history" mode until all proxies in the
cluster have been upgraded. Attempting to use the "history" mode during
a rolling upgrade may result in some requests being served by proxies
running old code (which necessarily uses the "stack" mode), leading to
data loss.

Change-Id: I555dc17fefd0aa9ade681aa156da24e018ebe74b

Supported modes are: # pop-version - the previous version is used to overwrite the current # version, then the previous version is deleted. # push-marker - the current version is copied to the versions location, # and a delete marker is used to overwrite the current # version. Subsequent GETs will respond with a 404. # default_delete_mode = pop-version

to the end user for execution.

commit_message:
Do not send shared param when not allowed.

When a user changes the name of a network,
neutron returns a 403 error.
Even if the user only changes the name and doesn't
change the shared state, Horizon send
the shared data to neutron and neutron returns
 403 when the user doesn't have admin rights

Change-Id: I52726b7215acb877f38069c95d190eb36399954f
Closes-Bug: #1609467
