WARNING: not recommended. Use with # caution. # Defaults to $:os_service_default # # [*auth_section*] # (Optional) Config Section from which to load plugin specific options # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*auth_type*] # (Optional) Authentication type to load # Defaults to 'password' # # [*auth_uri*] # (Optional) Complete public Identity API endpoint. # Defaults to 'http://127.0.0.1:5000/' # # [*auth_version*] # (Optional) API version of the admin Identity API endpoint. # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*cache*] # (Optional) Env key for the swift cache. # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*cafile*] # (Optional) A PEM encoded Certificate Authority to use when verifying HTTPs # connections. # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*certfile*] # (Optional) Required if identity server requires client certificate # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*check_revocations_for_cached*] # (Optional) If true, the revocation list will be checked for cached tokens. # This requires that PKI tokens are configured on the identity server. # boolean value. # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*delay_auth_decision*] # (Optional) Do not handle authorization requests within the middleware, but # delegate the authorization decision to downstream WSGI components. Boolean # value # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*enforce_token_bind*] # (Optional) Used to control the use and type of token binding. Can be set # to: "disabled" to not check token binding. "permissive" (default) to # validate binding information if the bind type is of a form known to the # server and ignore it if not. "strict" like "permissive" but if the bind # type is unknown the token will be rejected. "required" any form of token # binding is needed to be allowed. Finally the name of a binding method that # must be present in tokens. String value. # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*hash_algorithms*] # (Optional) Hash algorithms to use for hashing PKI tokens. This may be a # single algorithm or multiple. The algorithms are those supported by Python # standard hashlib.new(). The hashes will be tried in the order given, so put # the preferred one first for performance. The result of the first hash will # be stored in the cache. This will typically be set to multiple values only # while migrating from a less secure algorithm to a more secure one. Once all # the old tokens are expired this option should be set to a single value for # better performance. List value. # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*http_connect_timeout*] # (Optional) Request timeout value for communicating with Identity API # server. # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*http_request_max_retries*] # (Optional) How many times are we trying to reconnect when communicating # with Identity API Server. Integer value # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*include_service_catalog*] # (Optional) Indicate whether to set the X-Service-Catalog header. If False, # middleware will not ask for service catalog on token validation and will # not set the X-Service-Catalog header. Boolean value. # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*keyfile*] # (Optional) Required if identity server requires client certificate # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*memcache_pool_conn_get_timeout*] # (Optional) Number of seconds that an operation will wait to get a memcached # client connection from the pool. Integer value # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*memcache_pool_dead_retry*] # (Optional) Number of seconds memcached server is considered dead before it # is tried again. Integer value # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*memcache_pool_maxsize*] # (Optional) Maximum total number of open connections to every memcached # server. Integer value # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*memcache_pool_socket_timeout*] # (Optional) Number of seconds a connection to memcached is held unused in # the pool before it is closed. Integer value # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*memcache_pool_unused_timeout*] # (Optional) Number of seconds a connection to memcached is held unused in # the pool before it is closed. Integer value # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*memcache_secret_key*] # (Optional, mandatory if memcache_security_strategy is defined) This string # is used for key derivation. # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*memcache_security_strategy*] # (Optional) If defined, indicate whether token data should be authenticated # or authenticated and encrypted. If MAC, token data is authenticated (with # HMAC) in the cache. If ENCRYPT, token data is encrypted and authenticated in the # cache. If the value is not one of these options or empty, auth_token will # raise an exception on initialization. # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*memcache_use_advanced_pool*] # (Optional) Use the advanced (eventlet safe) memcached client pool. The # advanced pool will only work under python 2.x Boolean value # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*memcached_servers*] # (Optional) Optionally specify a list of memcached server(s) to use for # caching. If left undefined, tokens will instead be cached in-process. # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*region_name*] # (Optional) The region in which the identity server can be found. # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*revocation_cache_time*] # (Optional) Determines the frequency at which the list of revoked tokens is # retrieved from the Identity service (in seconds). A high number of # revocation events combined with a low cache duration may significantly # reduce performance. Only valid for PKI tokens. Integer value # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*signing_dir*] # (Optional) Directory used to cache files related to PKI tokens. # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*token_cache_time*] # (Optional) In order to prevent excessive effort spent validating tokens, # the middleware caches previously-seen tokens for a configurable duration # (in seconds). Set to -1 to disable caching completely. commit_message:
remove grenade jobs from horizon

With the removal of tempest tests for horizon, there are no longer any
validation for horizon working after an upgrade in the grenade
tests. We should stop running grenade on horizon. Any upgrade testing
in horizon should come via dedicated efforts in the future.

Change-Id: I2032683f3272188ea2e66a0d27e1f0ac240cf008

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-27 15:47:22.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/vmt-process.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ossa/commit/6e835ab28fce1facbee3b6b6d9df3be7d93dec4d', 'message': 'Add "Invalid" status to OSSA Task status

"Invalid" should be used when the reported issue is not a bug or
is marked as invalid by the project as it is not a bug/vulnerability.
This is distinct from "Won't Fix" as it indicates there is something
to the report, but nothing for the VMT to do.

Change-Id: I72598c0954a17fd26a4f12513ff28fc2625c374e
'}]
commit_message:
Add "Invalid" status to OSSA Task status

"Invalid" should be used when the reported issue is not a bug or
is marked as invalid by the project as it is not a bug/vulnerability.
This is distinct from "Won't Fix" as it indicates there is something
to the report, but nothing for the VMT to do.

Change-Id: I72598c0954a17fd26a4f12513ff28fc2625c374e

commit_message:
Break tests for 1614141

When the default_domain is not in the catalog, but another non-default
domain is, the code gets confused and makes the domain in the catalog
default.

Change-Id: Ic85246526aab105de4ba4fe4a587b78b73beb91d

commit_message:
only look for v2 objects on upgrade

upgrade fails if we upgrade an already upgraded storage because it
grabs split keys and isn't aware of what version to look for. this
patch makes sure upgrade only looks for v2 objects to upgrade and
filters anything else.

Change-Id: Ifb27c845b716a4d0cf9215e78617398ebd09b6e8
Closes-Bug: #1611912
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi refs/changes/49/354049/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Create puppet-panko repository

Panko provides events functionality to Telemetry. This repo
contains specific configuration files, services, endpoints, etc.

It requires a new Puppet module to be created and be part of
Puppet OpenStack modules.

Source: https://github.com/openstack/panko

Needed-By: Ia20e8534b93a8b295b2f6a07a87754663bd1d868

Change-Id: I4f3a6021eb14480357760d8f8a5d2dd28262b72e

commit_message:
Revert "Configure keystone authtoken options"

This reverts commit eef5b11679e1c0e96a782f51f5e0c8aa6abfb3bd.

Ironic still uses deprecated auth parameters:
https://github.com/openstack/ironic/blob/master/ironic/common/keystone.py#L95-L98

Revert this revert once ironic uses non-deprecated
auth parameters.

Change-Id: I057ab787578c1a4adbfee1f2bd6d2b61e431450d
Related-bug: #1616873

commit_message:
Move OPT_CONFIG after release env file

By moving the OPT_CONFIG file after the release environment file in
quickstart.sh we allow a user to customize the variables set in the
release file via the --config option.

Change-Id: I18f8609b60c18544580c24862535228ce7eeaddd
Closes-Bug: 1616859

The symbol for auth algorithm sha256 is different in openswan/libreswan
and strongswan. For openswan/libreswan it is sha2_256 and for strongswan

"}]
commit_message:
Strongswan: Fix incorrect strongswan auth algorithm sha256 symbol

The symbol for auth algorithm sha256 is different in openswan/libreswan
and strongswan. For openswan/libreswan it is sha2_256 and for strongswan
it should be sha256. This patch override DIALECT_MAP['sha256'] to 'sha256'
in strongswan device driver.

Closes-Bug: #1614792

Change-Id: I1cfb3e350dfebe266554ead000df1474c87a6e5b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas refs/changes/67/357567/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.DIALECT_MAP['sha256'] = 'sha256'

commit_message:
TrivialFix: Cleanup imports in code

In some part in the code we import objects. In the Openstack
style guidelines they recommend to import only modules[1].

[1]: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#imports

Change-Id: I80508227036f240b96ad9d1e0fb5577a4d102cd1

commit_message:
Add Magnum deployment to setup-openstack playbook

This patch adds the Magnum playbook to the setup-openstack meta
playbook to ensure that Magnum is deployed if the inventory
contains any appropriate hosts.

The release note for the new service has also been adjusted to
be more accurate.

Change-Id: I7634b10ca4f39e0aa203fed0cca9f795ee34e894
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/28/360428/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - Experimental support has been added to allow the deployment of the the OpenStack Magnum service by allocating hosts to the host group ``magnum-infra_hosts``.
deleted_lines: - Adding support for Magnum to be built as part of the repo build process. - Adding the ``os-magnum-install.yml`` file to deploy magnum to hosts tagged with hostgroup ``magnum_all``.

run-upgrade.sh is designated to re-run from the place
where it failed. Previous behavior is to print entire tasks list
when failures happen. Printing tasks that successfully
completed is not desired. The new update will only show leftover

Change-Id: I2e33c43d55696bb91cb40ff590e167546f5f6d18

commit_message:
Print remaining tasks on failed upgrade correctly

run-upgrade.sh is designated to re-run from the place
where it failed. Previous behavior is to print entire tasks list
when failures happen. Printing tasks that successfully
completed is not desired. The new update will only show leftover
tasks for the users debugging.

Change-Id: I2e33c43d55696bb91cb40ff590e167546f5f6d18
Closes-Bug:1582272
(cherry picked from commit 619b40c35102964e1a861dd473e7635d2eb7b642)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/85/360385/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: echo "Failed on task \"$run_item\"" # NOTE: # List the remaining, incompleted tasks from the tasks array. # Using seq to genertate a sequence which starts from the spot # where previous exception or failures happened. for item in $(seq $1 $((${#RUN_TASKS[@]} - 1))); do if [ -n "${RUN_TASKS[$item]}" ]; then echo "openstack-ansible ${RUN_TASKS[$item]} -e 'pip_install_options=--force-reinstall'" fi
deleted_lines: echo "Failed on task $run_item" for item in ${!RUN_TASKS[@]}; do echo "openstack-ansible ${RUN_TASKS[$item]} -e 'pip_install_options=--force-reinstall'"

subject: Inject undercloud's CA into python-ironic-agent image
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-15 06:15:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci/commit/0023c0b7a45ea4c9ef6c32a83a88cbf28ecbb96c', 'message': "Inject undercloud's CA into python-ironic-agent image

If SSL is enabled, we need the images to trust the undercloud's CA.
This kind of worked since we had a self-signed undercloud image, which
we could cache and it would still work. However, the key should have
changed, so there should have been SSL verification errors.

This behavior changed with the introduction of certmonger. We now
use a CA certificate provided by certmonger, which is local and
specific to the undercloud. With this we can no longer share that
CA, so we need to inject it to the image after it has been generated
(after the undercloud run).

commit_message:
Inject undercloud's CA into python-ironic-agent image

If SSL is enabled, we need the images to trust the undercloud's CA.
This kind of worked since we had a self-signed undercloud image, which
we could cache and it would still work. However, the key should have
changed, so there should have been SSL verification errors.

This behavior changed with the introduction of certmonger. We now
use a CA certificate provided by certmonger, which is local and
specific to the undercloud. With this we can no longer share that
CA, so we need to inject it to the image after it has been generated
(after the undercloud run).

Change-Id: I5bb1c780e21bbc04a24d9fa39350f028e6153306
Closes-Bug: #1613088
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/12/355312/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: source $TRIPLEO_ROOT/tripleo-ci/scripts/common_functions.sh # We might want to skip this also in the multinode scenario if we enable SSL in # it. if [ $UNDERCLOUD_SSL == 1 ] ; then # The CA coming from autogenerate is undercloud-specific, so we shouldn't # be caching this as it will differ between runs. inject_ca $PWD/ironic-python-agent.initramfs "/etc/pki/ca-trust/source/anchors/cm-local-ca.pem" fi

commit_message:
The patchset implements scenario test for basic connectivity test
using service group with FwaaS
Implements: blueprint fwaas-customized-service for customized service

Change-Id: I4e8de49589148367bcc7e30c4e355188fce3cabf
Authored-by: badveli vishnuvardhan <badveli_vishnuus@yahoo.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-fwaas refs/changes/53/200753/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # NOTE: The purpose of this module is to provide a nop test to verify that # the functional gate is working. import copy import os import fixtures import mock import netaddr from neutron.agent.common import config as agent_config from neutron.agent import l3_agent as l3_agent_main from neutron.agent.linux import ip_lib from neutron.agent.linux import utils as linux_utils from neutron.common import config as common_config from neutron.common import utils as common_utils from neutron.openstack.common import uuidutils from neutron.plugins.common import constants from neutron.services.provider_configuration import serviceprovider_opts from neutron.tests.common import net_helpers from neutron.tests.functional import base from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_log import log as logging _uuid = uuidutils.generate_uuid FAKE_SRC_PREFIX = '10.0.0.0/24' FAKE_DST_PREFIX = '20.0.0.0/24' FAKE_PROTOCOL = 'tcp' FAKE_SRC_PORT = 5000 FAKE_DST_PORT = 22 FAKE_FW_ID = 'fake-fw-uuid' PUBLIC_NET = netaddr.IPNetwork('19.4.4.0/24') PRIVATE_NET = netaddr.IPNetwork('35.4.0.0/16') FAKE_PUBLIC_SUBNET_ID = _uuid() FAKE_PRIVATE_SUBNET_ID = _uuid() MAC_BASE = cfg.CONF.base_mac.split(':') FAKE_ROUTER = { 'id': _uuid(), '_interfaces': [ { 'id': _uuid(), 'admin_state_up': True, 'network_id': _uuid(), 'mac_address': common_utils.get_random_mac(MAC_BASE), 'subnets': [ { 'ipv6_ra_mode': None, 'cidr': str(PRIVATE_NET), 'gateway_ip': str(PRIVATE_NET[1]), 'id': FAKE_PRIVATE_SUBNET_ID, 'ipv6_address_mode': None } ], 'fixed_ips': [ { 'subnet_id': FAKE_PRIVATE_SUBNET_ID, 'prefixlen': 24, 'ip_address': PRIVATE_NET[4] } ] } ], 'enable_snat': True, 'gw_port': { 'network_id': _uuid(), 'subnets': [ { 'cidr': str(PUBLIC_NET), 'gateway_ip': str(PUBLIC_NET[1]), 'id': FAKE_PUBLIC_SUBNET_ID } ], 'fixed_ips': [ { 'subnet_id': FAKE_PUBLIC_SUBNET_ID, 'prefixlen': PUBLIC_NET.prefixlen, 'ip_address': str(PUBLIC_NET[4]) } ], 'id': _uuid(), 'mac_address': common_utils.get_random_mac(MAC_BASE) }, 'distributed': False, '_floatingips': [], 'routes': [] } class RouterFixture(fixtures.Fixture): def __init__(self, l3_agent, public_ip, private_cidr): self.l3_agent = l3_agent self.router_info = self._generate_info(public_ip, private_cidr) self.router_id = self.router_info['id'] def setUp(self): super(RouterFixture, self).setUp() self.l3_agent._process_added_router(self.router_info) self.router = self.l3_agent.router_info[self.router_id] self.addCleanup(self.l3_agent._router_removed, self.router_id) def _generate_info(self, public_ip, private_cidr): info = copy.deepcopy(FAKE_ROUTER) info['id'] = _uuid() info['_interfaces'][0]['id'] = _uuid() (info['_interfaces'][0] ['mac_address']) = common_utils.get_random_mac(MAC_BASE) (info['_interfaces'][0]['fixed_ips'][0] ['ip_address']) = str(private_cidr[1]) info['_interfaces'][0]['subnets'][0].update({ 'cidr': str(private_cidr), 'gateway_ip': private_cidr[1]}) info['gw_port']['id'] = _uuid() info['gw_port']['fixed_ips'][0]['ip_address'] = str(public_ip) info['gw_port']['mac_address'] = common_utils.get_random_mac(MAC_BASE) return info class TestServiceGroupScenario(base.BaseSudoTestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestIPSecScenario, self).setUp() mock.patch('neutron.agent.l3.agent.L3PluginApi').start() cfg.CONF.set_override('debug', True) agent_config.setup_logging() config = cfg.ConfigOpts() config.register_opts(common_config.core_opts) config.register_opts(common_config.core_cli_opts) logging.register_options(config) agent_config.register_process_monitor_opts(config) l3_agent_main.register_opts(config) config.set_override( 'interface_driver', 'neutron.agent.linux.interface.OVSInterfaceDriver') config.set_override('router_delete_namespaces', True) config.register_opts(serviceprovider_opts, 'service_providers') config.set_override('state_path', self.get_new_temp_dir().path) self.br_int = self.useFixture(net_helpers.OVSBridgeFixture()).bridge self.br_ex = self.useFixture(net_helpers.OVSBridgeFixture()).bridge config.set_override('ovs_integration_bridge', self.br_int.br_name) config.set_override('external_network_bridge', self.br_ex.br_name) # Assign ip address to br-ex port because it is a gateway ex_port = ip_lib.IPDevice(self.br_ex.br_name) ex_port.addr.add(str(PUBLIC_NET[1])) def port_setup(self, router): """Creates namespace and a port inside it on a client site.""" client_ns = self.useFixture(net_helpers.NamespaceFixture()).ip_wrapper router_ip_cidr = self._port_first_ip_cidr(router.internal_ports[0]) port_ip_cidr = net_helpers.increment_ip_cidr(router_ip_cidr) port = self.useFixture( net_helpers.OVSPortFixture(self.br_int, client_ns.namespace)).port port.addr.add(port_ip_cidr) port.route.add_gateway(router_ip_cidr.partition('/')[0]) return client_ns.namespace, port_ip_cidr.partition('/')[0] def _port_first_ip_cidr(self, port): fixed_ip = port['fixed_ips'][0] return common_utils.ip_to_cidr(fixed_ip['ip_address'], fixed_ip['prefixlen']) def _ping(self, namespace, ip): """Pings ip address from network namespace. In order to ping it uses following cli command: ip netns exec <namespace> ping -c 4 -q <ip> """ try: cmd = ['ping', '-c', '4', '-q', ip] cmd = ip_lib.add_namespace_to_cmd(cmd, namespace) linux_utils.execute(cmd, run_as_root=True) return True except RuntimeError: return False def test_firewall_with_servicegroup(self): # instantiate network resources "router", "private network" self.assertTrue(self._ping(site1['port_namespace'], site2['port_ip'])) self.assertTrue(self._ping(site2['port_namespace'], site1['port_ip']))

subject: Support multiple rabbitmq clusters
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-20 15:19:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/203e8f51db917e3d79aaec4fd4ec194d0689c081', 'message': 'Support multiple rabbitmq clusters

The rabbitmq-install play now supports a variable
inventory host group defined with *rabbitmq_host_group*.

This allows deployers to use the play to create multiple
RabbitMQ clusters using for example:

Typical infra cluster:

  openstack-ansible rabbitmq-install.yml

Second cluster for telemetry:

  openstack-ansible -e "rabbitmq_host_group=telemetry_rabbitmq_all" rabbitmq-install.yml

Use case is more fully explained here:

http://trumant.github.io/openstack-ansible-multiple-rabbitmq-clusters.html

Change-Id: I737711085fc0e50c4c5a0ee7c2037927574f8448
Implements: blueprint multi-rabbitmq-clusters

'}, {'number': 14, 'created': '2016-08-04 01:01:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/8b4990be459926d049f7f524a5b026c284dcfb62', 'message': 'Support multiple rabbitmq clusters

The rabbitmq-install play now supports a variable
inventory host group defined with *rabbitmq_host_group*.

This allows deployers to use the play to create multiple
RabbitMQ clusters using for example:

Typical infra cluster:

  openstack-ansible rabbitmq-install.yml

Second cluster for telemetry:

  openstack-ansible -e "rabbitmq_host_group=telemetry_rabbitmq_all" rabbitmq-install.yml

Many vars were moved from group-specific group_vars to the "all" group
as the ceilometer role/play requires the RabbitMQ details and telemetry enabled
state for all services that can potentially be monitored by ceilometer.

By default, the "telemetry cluster" and the "RPC" cluster are the same, but
deployers that wish to create multiple clusters are able to override the
*_rabbitmq_telemetry_* vars when choosing to run separate clusters.

Use case is more fully explained here:

http://trumant.github.io/openstack-ansible-multiple-rabbitmq-clusters.html

commit_message:
Support multiple rabbitmq clusters

The rabbitmq-install play now supports a variable
inventory host group defined with *rabbitmq_host_group*.

This allows deployers to use the play to create multiple
RabbitMQ clusters using for example:

Typical infra cluster:

  openstack-ansible rabbitmq-install.yml

Second cluster for telemetry:

  openstack-ansible -e "rabbitmq_host_group=telemetry_rabbitmq_all" rabbitmq-install.yml

Many vars were moved from group-specific group_vars to the "all" group
as the ceilometer role/play requires the RabbitMQ details and telemetry enabled
state for all services that can potentially be monitored by ceilometer.

By default, the "telemetry cluster" and the "RPC" cluster are the same, but
deployers that wish to create multiple clusters are able to override the
*_rabbitmq_telemetry_* vars when choosing to run separate clusters.

Use case is more fully explained here:

http://trumant.github.io/openstack-ansible-multiple-rabbitmq-clusters.html

Change-Id: I737711085fc0e50c4c5a0ee7c2037927574f8448

commit_message:
Add a tenant ID check to create a bgpvpn resource

Only in the opencontrail driver (as other neutron resource creation)
Improve the opecontrail_client by adding the 'project' resource
Add a function that check the tenant ID by reading (show) the project
Made the check in bgpvpn 'create' and 'update' functions

Change-Id: Iedea7863bed39d9a8f4bff1e2fa647bdd45ba3a5
Closes-Bug: #1604748
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-bgpvpn refs/changes/40/354640/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import uuid def _is_tenant_id_exist(self, oc_client, tenant_id): tenant_id = str(uuid.UUID(tenant_id)) oc_client.show('Project', tenant_id) oc_client = self._get_opencontrail_api_client(context) # Check if tenant ID exist self._is_tenant_id_exist(oc_client, bgpvpn['tenant_id'])

commit_message:
Add functional test for wait_for_finish

Change-Id: Ia2793b62fe6344c4bfeb943a1521f02a6d673ebb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-ironic-inspector-client refs/changes/04/357804/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_wait_for_finish(self): shared = [0] # mutable structure to hold number of retries def fake_waiter(delay): shared[0] += 1 if shared[0] == 2: # On the second wait simulate data arriving res = self.call_continue(self.data) self.assertEqual({'uuid': self.uuid}, res) elif shared[0] > 2: # Just wait afterwards eventlet.greenthread.sleep(functional.DEFAULT_SLEEP) self.client.introspect(self.uuid) eventlet.greenthread.sleep(functional.DEFAULT_SLEEP) status = self.client.get_status(self.uuid) self.assertEqual({'finished': False, 'error': None}, status) self.client.wait_for_finish([self.uuid], sleep_function=fake_waiter) status = self.client.get_status(self.uuid) self.assertEqual({'finished': True, 'error': None}, status)

commit_message:
Deprecate global functions in favor of ClientV1 methods

These are bulky and hard to update. Using a client instance is also
more in line with other OpenStack clients.

Change-Id: I60efeb1b54ea44e59382a2c9f6537677cff07597

commit_message:
Enable Angular Image panel

This patch enables the Angular Image panel and deprecates the Django-based
Image panel.

It changes the Django configuration switch and the integration test switch.

Change-Id: I5a8b188985a28c246160210e0c87122519339c64
Partially-Implements: blueprint angularize-images-table

commit_message:
Add initial spec file for python-congressclient

Change-Id: Ie4fbf14c9da5d99d03c4ed24c9443fa142d5af75
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rpm-packaging refs/changes/77/279477/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: %global sname python-congressclient Name: python-congressclient Version: 1.1.0 Release: 0 Summary: Client library for Congress License: Apache URL: http://pypi.python.org/pypi/%{name} Source0: https://pypi.python.org/packages/source/p/%{sname}/%{sname}-%{version}.tar.gz BuildArch: noarch BuildRequires: python-devel BuildRequires: {{ 'setuptools' | py2pkg }} BuildRequires: {{ 'pbr' | py2pkg }} BuildRequires: {{ 'd2to1' | py2pkg }} BuildRequires: {{ 'testrepository' | py2pkg }} BuildRequires: {{ 'mock' | py2pkg }} >= 1.2 BuildRequires: {{ 'Babel' | py2pkg }} >= 1.3 BuildRequires: {{ 'cliff' | py2pkg }} >= 1.14.0 BuildRequires: {{ 'python-keystoneclient' | py2pkg }} >= 1:1.6.0 Requires: {{ 'pbr' | py2pkg }} >= 1.6 Requires: {{ 'Babel' | py2pkg }} >= 1.3 Requires: {{ 'cliff' | py2pkg }} >= 1.14.0 Requires: {{ 'six' | py2pkg }} >= 1.9.0 Requires: {{ 'requests' | py2pkg }} >= 2.5.2 Requires: {{ 'oslo.i18n' | py2pkg }} >= 1.5.0 Requires: {{ 'python-keystoneclient' | py2pkg }} >= 1:1.6.0 Requires: {{ 'setuptools' | py2pkg }} %description Sytem package - python-congressclient Python package - python-congressclient %prep %setup -q -n python-congressclient-%{version} %build %{__python} setup.py build %install rm -rf %{buildroot} %{__python} setup.py install -O1 --skip-build --root %{buildroot} %check export PYTHONPATH="%{python2_sitearch}:%{python2_sitelib}:%{buildroot}%{python2_sitelib}" export PYTHON="%{__python2} -S" testr init && testr run %clean rm -rf %{buildroot} %files %defattr(644,root,root,755) %{python_sitelib}/ %changelog

commit_message:
Use constraints for all the things

This configures tox to use upper-constraints for everything.

Change-Id: I5611d0d9052d26a2e9e0b63fc302e4c65b83ba7c

commit_message:
remove openstack/common from the exclude list of flake in tox.ini

The directory openstack/common was used to keep codes from oslo-incubator,
 we have retired oslo-incubator, so don't use this directory any more.

Change-Id: Ib2905b65ed8fd15bde5b47f3af3f66ce123d2bc1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-ceilometerclient refs/changes/60/360460/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [testenv:debug] commands = bash -x oslo_debug_helper {posargs} exclude = .venv,.git,.tox,dist,doc,*lib/python*,*egg,build,tools

commit_message:
Add build_version generating

* drop per-deb pkg version
* drop FUEL_PLUGIN_MURANO_COMMIT version
* drop MURANO_TARBALL_COMMIT version

Change-Id: I92faf135a9e5238e7f3e24b440278676cd260343
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-plugin-murano refs/changes/79/357179/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Generate version file in format: # Build: $build_date # FUEL_PLUGIN_COMMIT=$sha # $pkg_name=$pkg_version function generate_version_file { local version_file="${1:-build_version}" local tmp_file=$(mktemp) echo "# Build: $(date +%Y-%m-%d-%H-%M-%S)" >> "${version_file}" echo "FUEL_PLUGIN_COMMIT=$(git rev-parse HEAD)" >> "${version_file}" while read -d '' -r pkg; do dpkg-deb -I "${pkg}"| awk '/Package:/{name=$2}/Version:/{ver=$2;print name"="ver}' >> "${tmp_file}" done < <(find "repositories/ubuntu" -name '*.deb' -print0) cat "${tmp_file}" | sort >> "${version_file}" rm -vf "${tmp_file}" }

commit_message:
Replace 'lsb_release -is' with the method 'get_os_distrib'

It helps identify the distribution using method 'get_is_distrib'
closes-bug: #1609505

revisions:

When using OVN native DHCP support, deleting a subnet without DHCP

commit_message:
Fix delete subnet without DHCP enabled

When using OVN native DHCP support, deleting a subnet without DHCP
enabled will result in delete_subnet_postcommit failing. Since this
failure is post commit to the neutron DB, the subnet is deleted from
neutron. This patch set fixes delete_subnet_postcommit to handle
subnets without DHCP options.

Change-Id: Icd0fa3025cfa9dd10b6e96d9b485716eb2cf6124
Related-Bug: #1514488
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/62/359162/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if subnet_dhcp_options: txn.add(self._nb_ovn.delete_dhcp_options( subnet_dhcp_options['uuid']))

commit_message:
Move provision tasks out of nailgun and astute

Provision and deletion tasks shouldn't be hardcoded into nailgun and
astute. This patch creates representation for these tasks in library
side as a separate graphs which can be executed in consecutive manner.

blueprint: graph-concept-extension

Change-Id: Icb55739ad1dbffa3c32341b1caea9046d7917240

commit_message:
Add action check function to senlin plugin

Add check_action_check function to senlin plugin. If action was
successfully executed, return true. If action is still in progress,
return false. If action failed, raise error.

Change-Id: I7ea269aae48ed76d3414b64d40ac3aa0158e27e4

subject: WIP: scheduler functional test framework preview
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-18 13:03:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/4e924c32a7b3246fae1819b3cf88b422cfde071f', 'message': 'WIP: scheduler functional test framework preview

Scheduler functional test framework is aimed to test the sanity of

for db updates.

Change-Id: I9ad0822933321ed7f42ad21b99b2dbe46c8aa2dd
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: scheduler functional test framework preview

Scheduler functional test framework is aimed to test the sanity of
scheduler decisions in the quickest way. It should be extensible to test
scheduler features including, but not limited to, image properties, host
aggregates, availability zones, compute capabilities, servergroups,
forced hosts, metrics etc.

This is a preview of this framework providing the feature of setting up
initial resource view, configuring all scheduler related configurations,
and checking the sanity of final decisions.

It is still too early to formalize the design of this functional test.
There will be a spec describing the final design if the prototype is
mature enough to provide all the expected features.

<Patch History>

PatchSet 1: Initialize the preview to setup resource view, configure
scheduler related configurations, and check the sanity of final
decisions.

PatchSet 2: Implemented AopFixture to notify db changes to the main
functional test greenthread, it is critical to ComputeFilter enabling.
And the main functional test thread no longer need to do polling to wait
for db updates.

Change-Id: I9ad0822933321ed7f42ad21b99b2dbe46c8aa2dd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/25/281825/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2016 OpenStack Foundation # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import collections import time from oslo_config import cfg from nova import test from nova.tests import fixtures as nova_fixtures from nova.tests.functional import api_paste_fixture from nova.tests.unit import fake_network from nova.tests.unit.image import fake as fake_image from nova.virt import fake as fake_driver CONF = cfg.CONF class ComputeResourceView(object): def __init__(self, hostname, vcpus=4, memory_mb=2048, local_gb=1024): self.hostname = hostname self.vcpus = vcpus self.memory_mb = memory_mb self.local_gb = local_gb class SchedulerTestBase(test.TestCase): REQUIRES_LOCKING = True api_major_version = 'v2' _image_ref_parameter = 'imageRef' _flavor_ref_parameter = 'flavorRef' # Scheduler related configurations _scheduler_default_filters = CONF.scheduler_default_filters _scheduler_weight_classes = CONF.scheduler_weight_classes _service_down_time = 2 _report_interval = 1 _max_retries = 1 _ram_allocation_ratio = 1.0 _cpu_allocation_ratio = 1.0 _disk_allocation_ratio = 1.0 # Compute related configurations _reserved_host_disk_mb = 0 _reserved_host_memory_mb = 0 _compute_driver = 'nova.virt.fake.SchedulerFakeDriver' _resources = [ComputeResourceView("host1")] def setUp(self): super(SchedulerTestBase, self).setUp() # NOTE(Yingxin): Temporory remove ComputeFilter because this functional # test doesn't wait until compute service record is updated in db. try: self._scheduler_default_filters.remove('ComputeFilter') except ValueError: pass self.flags(scheduler_default_filters=self._scheduler_default_filters) self.flags(scheduler_weight_classes=self._scheduler_weight_classes) self.flags(service_down_time=self._service_down_time) self.flags(report_interval=self._report_interval) self.flags(scheduler_max_attempts = self._max_retries) self.flags(ram_allocation_ratio = self._ram_allocation_ratio) self.flags(cpu_allocation_ratio = self._cpu_allocation_ratio) self.flags(disk_allocation_ratio = self._disk_allocation_ratio) self.flags(compute_driver = self._compute_driver) self.flags(reserved_host_disk_mb = self._reserved_host_disk_mb) self.flags(reserved_host_memory_mb = self._reserved_host_memory_mb) if self.api_major_version == 'v2.1': api_fixture = self.useFixture(nova_fixtures.OSAPIFixture( api_version='v2.1')) else: self.useFixture(api_paste_fixture.ApiPasteLegacyV2Fixture()) api_fixture = self.useFixture(nova_fixtures.OSAPIFixture( api_version='v2')) self.api = api_fixture.api self.admin_api = api_fixture.admin_api # the image fake backend needed for image discovery fake_image.stub_out_image_service(self) self.addCleanup(fake_image.FakeImageService_reset) self.start_service('conductor', manager=CONF.conductor.manager) self.start_service('scheduler') self.start_service('network') # TODO(Yingxin): The setUp should wait until compute service record is # updated in db. Or the ComputeFilter will fail because there is no # update time in db, and all the compute services are thus considered # down. But if we setup a polling to query db maybe every 0.2 # secondes, it will make funcional tests run much slower. An idea is to # inject events to notify functional tests that the compute service is # ready. self.computes = {} self.compute_resources = {} self._build_compute_resources() fake_network.set_stub_network_methods(self) def _build_compute_resources(self): for view in self._resources: fake_driver.SchedulerFakeDriver.prepare_resource(view) compute = self.start_service('compute', host=view.hostname) self.computes[view.hostname] = compute self.compute_resources[view.hostname] = compute.driver.resources self.addCleanup(compute.kill) def _wait_for_state_change(self, server, max_retries=10): _FINAL_STATES_SET = {"ERROR", "VERIFY_RESIZE", "ACTIVE"} retry_count = 0 while True: server = self.admin_api.get_server(server['id']) if server['status'] in _FINAL_STATES_SET: return server['status'], server retry_count += 1 if retry_count == max_retries: # NOTE(Yingxin): Unexpected status # TODO(Yingxin): It is dumb to wait for the status change, find # a way to workaround. This is why test_server_group runs slow. return server['status'], server time.sleep(0.5) return "UNKNOWN", server def boot_servers(self, flavor=None, numbers=1): servers = collections.defaultdict(list) for _ in range(0, numbers): state, server = self._boot_a_server(flavor=flavor) servers[state].append(server) return servers def _boot_a_server(self, flavor=None): server = self._build_minimal_create_server_request('some-server') if flavor: server[self._flavor_ref_parameter] = ('http://fake.server/%s' % flavor['id']) post = {'server': server} created_server = self.api.post_server(post) self.assertTrue(created_server['id']) state, server = self._wait_for_state_change(created_server) return state, server def _build_minimal_create_server_request(self, name): server = {} # TODO(Yingxin): We should not rely on built-in flavors and images. # There will be a mechanism to define personalized flavers to test. # NOTE(Yingxin): It costs a lot of time in quering this image list. images = self.api.get_images() image = images[0] if self._image_ref_parameter not in image: server[self._image_ref_parameter] = ('http://fake.server/%s' % image['id']) flavors = self.api.get_flavors() flavor = flavors[0] server[self._flavor_ref_parameter] = ('http://fake.server/%s' % flavor['id']) server['name'] = name return server class SchedulerTestPreview1(SchedulerTestBase): def test_boot_servers(self): servers = self.boot_servers(numbers=6) self.assertEqual(4, len(servers['ACTIVE'])) self.assertEqual(2, len(servers['ERROR'])) self.assertEqual(2048, self.compute_resources['host1'].memory_mb_used) class SchedulerTestPreview2(SchedulerTestBase): _resources = [ComputeResourceView("host1", vcpus=8, memory_mb=1024, local_gb=200), ComputeResourceView("host2", vcpus=8, memory_mb=1536, local_gb=200), ] def test_boot_servers(self): servers = self.boot_servers(numbers=6) self.assertEqual(5, len(servers['ACTIVE'])) self.assertEqual(1, len(servers['ERROR'])) self.assertEqual(1024, self.compute_resources['host1'].memory_mb_used) self.assertEqual(1536, self.compute_resources['host2'].memory_mb_used)

commit_message:
Add VNC console support for ironic virt driver.

Implements get_vnc_console method for ironic virt driver.
VNC server on baremetal servers requires password authentication.
This change also introduces new optional field for password.

Change-Id: Id58f354f44821f1c98452a6877928279534956cb

xenapi: refactor _call_live_migrate_command

Try to make _call_live_migrate_command easier to understand.

Change-Id: I55d961170cc1d441eeb287de7d33b4a4ef0cb53f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/91/293991/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _get_marshallble_send_data(self, migrate_data): # NOTE(coreywright): though a nullable object field, migrate_send_data # is required for XenAPI live migration commands 'XenAPI requires migrate_send_data in migrate data') # NOTE(coreywright): convert to xmlrpc marshallable type return dict(migrate_send_data) def _get_migrate_vdi_map(self, vm_ref, migrate_data): if 'destination_sr_ref' not in migrate_data: raise exception.InvalidParameterValue( 'XenAPI requires destination_sr_ref in migrate data') # create vdi_map for locally managed ephemeral disks # as part of the pre migration callback, i.e. cinder volumes if sr_uuid_map: for sr_uuid in sr_uuid_map: # Source and destination SRs have the same UUID, # so get the reference for the local SR sr_ref = self._session.call_xenapi( "SR.get_by_uuid", sr_uuid) vdi_map.update( self._generate_vdi_map( sr_uuid_map[sr_uuid], vm_ref, sr_ref)) def _call_live_migrate_command(self, command_name, vm_ref, migrate_data): """unpack xapi specific parameters, and call a live migrate command.""" migrate_send_data = self._get_marshallble_send_data(migrate_data) vdi_map = self._get_migrate_vdi_map(vm_ref, migrate_data)
deleted_lines: def _call_live_migrate_command(self, command_name, vm_ref, migrate_data): """unpack xapi specific parameters, and call a live migrate command.""" # NOTE(coreywright): though a nullable object field, migrate_send_data # is required for XenAPI live migration commands 'XenAPI requires destination migration data') # NOTE(coreywright): convert to xmlrpc marshallable type migrate_send_data = dict(migrate_send_data) # as part of the pre migration callback sr_uuid_map = None if sr_uuid_map: for sr_uuid in sr_uuid_map: # Source and destination SRs have the same UUID, so get the # reference for the local SR sr_ref = self._session.call_xenapi("SR.get_by_uuid", sr_uuid) vdi_map.update( self._generate_vdi_map( sr_uuid_map[sr_uuid], vm_ref, sr_ref))

commit_message:
Replaced code error 400 with 403 for over quota

As reported in the bug, the quota exceeded error on API level needs
to be updated to use code 403. This patch simply updates the only
over quota error of nova.api.openstack.compute.tenant_networks which
still uses 400.

Change-Id: Ibc72ba9f1c38cb87787cf0bdee973fd9bce53542
Closes-Bug: #1451991

commit_message:
Update the file for IPv4-only or IPv6-only network

Clean the interface template file by making both IP versions independent,
including when using LXC containers.

Closes-Bug:#1355171

commit_message:
Check volume status before call detach-volume

check the volume status before nova-compute call detach-volume to cinder-api.
because there are the inconsistent status of a volume between nova and
cinder.

Closes-bug: #1552265

revisions:

commit_message:
Security group rule create does not accept ip protocol numbers

Currently Security group rule create command is not accepting
"any" or "-1" as a protocol option.

To provide support for "any" as a protocol name, from_port and
to_port need to be updated as "None" in accordance with
novaclient code changes.

Change-Id: I96f768b17ad388f05b101e8fda8e5279cf71de5b
Closes-Bug: #1500455
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/47/251247/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if ip_protocol.upper() not in ['TCP', 'UDP', 'ICMP', 'ANY']: if (ip_protocol.upper() == 'ANY'): values['protocol'] = None values['from_port'] = None values['to_port'] = None else: values['protocol'] = ip_protocol values['from_port'] = from_port values['to_port'] = to_port
deleted_lines: if ip_protocol.upper() not in ['TCP', 'UDP', 'ICMP']: values['protocol'] = ip_protocol values['from_port'] = from_port values['to_port'] = to_port

commit_message:
Add inject NMI support to ironic driver.

This patch introduces a new power state "INJECT_NMI" to ironic driver,
and add a new method "inject_nmi" to implement that action.

Change-Id: I840bc31f188051ad4a5e53dbaa14b2b555b37642
Implements: blueprint inject-nmi-ironic
Related-to: blueprint enhance-power-interface-for-soft-reboot-and-nmi
Co-Authored-By: Tang Chen <chen.tang@easystack.cn>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/11/283411/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: INJECT_NMI = 'inject nmi' """ Node is injected an NMI. """

interim trove-client release

This is an interim client release for Trove. Another release is
expected before the Newton freeze.

commit_message:
(WIP)Filter instance query result for DB who doesn't support regex

Some DBs (eg. DB2) do not have build-in regex support. Need to use
python to filter the result set of db query, in order to satisfy
the regex filtering requirement of Nova api.

Co-Authored-By: Man Li Qi <qimanli@cn.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I79b114483de3874905d000f32fb729197f1cfc87
Closes-Bug: 1383325
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/74/130174/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: [WIP]Add config option "scheduler_compute_node_update_interval" for scheduler
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-23 09:13:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/e2bb5e83544183f54a907d318f204c73f8661b69', 'message': 'Add config option "scheduler_compute_node_update_interval" for scheduler

In nova-scheduler, we now uses
scheduler/host_manager/update_from_compute_node()
to update information about a host from a ComputeNode
object. Currently, the information won't update
if the updated time in scheduler is latter than
the updated_at time in compute:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/scheduler/host_manager.py#L162-L164

This is generally correct but as the periodic task
updates information in compute only update the information
when if there are changes:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/compute/resource_tracker.py#L659

This may cause inconsistency if the scheduler have
consumed(updated) the information but then the compute
fail to claim (the periodic task won't update because
there are no changes).

This patch adds a config option "scheduler_compute_node_update_interval".
If the updated time in scheduler is latter than
updated_at in compute but the difference bettween the
updated time in scheduler and current time is larger
than this interval, it will still update the information
from compute to avoid inconsistency. The default value
of this config option is set to be 300 seconds for reference.

Change-Id: I095c8eb01f6087a73b1dbf2f5500a2a8a674615e
Closes-bug: #1528743
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-24 01:34:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/3ed5a1c15f715164ac4db6f57716c7bcc88754df', 'message': '[WIP]Add config option "scheduler_compute_node_update_interval" for scheduler

object. Currently, the information won't update
if the updated time in scheduler is latter than
the updated_at time in compute:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/scheduler/host_manager.py#L162-L164

This is generally correct but as the periodic task
updates information in compute only update the information
when if there are changes:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/compute/resource_tracker.py#L659

This may cause inconsistency if the scheduler have
consumed(updated) the information but then the compute
fail to claim (the periodic task won't update because
there are no changes).

This patch adds a config option "scheduler_compute_node_update_interval".
If the updated time in scheduler is latter than
updated_at in compute but the difference bettween the
updated time in scheduler and current time is larger
than this interval, it will still update the information
from compute to avoid inconsistency. The default value
of this config option is set to be 300 seconds for reference.

Doc-impact:

Change-Id: I095c8eb01f6087a73b1dbf2f5500a2a8a674615e
Closes-bug: #1528743

commit_message:
[WIP]Add config option "scheduler_compute_node_update_interval" for scheduler

In nova-scheduler, we now use
scheduler/host_manager/update_from_compute_node()
to update information about a host from a ComputeNode
object. Currently, the information won't update
if the updated time in scheduler is later than
the updated_at time in compute:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/scheduler/host_manager.py#L162-L164

This is generally correct but as the periodic task
updates information in compute only update the information
when if there are changes:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/compute/resource_tracker.py#L659

This may cause inconsistency if the scheduler have
consumed(updated) the information but then the compute
fail to claim (the periodic task won't update because
there are no changes).

This patch adds a config option "scheduler_compute_node_update_interval".
If the updated time in scheduler is later than
updated_at in compute but the difference bettween the
updated time in scheduler and current time is larger
than this interval, it will still update the information
from compute to avoid inconsistency. The default value
of this config option is set to be 300 seconds for reference.

Doc-impact:

Change-Id: I095c8eb01f6087a73b1dbf2f5500a2a8a674615e
Closes-bug: #1528743
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/20/260920/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: update_interval = CONF.scheduler_compute_node_update_interval now = timeutils.utcnow().replace(tzinfo=iso8601.iso8601.Utc()) and self.updated > compute.updated_at and self.updated - now < update_interval):

commit_message:
Fix high severity, high confidence bandit issues

When running `tox -e bandit` a couple high confidence, high severity
issues were reported related to jinja2 autoescaping.  This fix uses
the recommendation from bandit and sets autoescape=True.

This patch does not resolve all of the issues reported out of bandit.
Future patches can address that.

Here's the paste output of the two high severity errors:
http://paste.openstack.org/show/418801/

Change-Id: I4b7094f1bb8ee1bf63d9a76b21ab927d19faa579

instance is not found can raise an InstanceUpdateConflict after 5 retries.

Since we were previously catching NotFound when that case occurred, we now have

commit_message:
Catch InstanceUpdateConflict when saving Instance at the top cell level

Post I293da6f320dd8f3474ce2a9c907298e1fb348181, a DB instance update where the
instance is not found can raise an InstanceUpdateConflict after 5 retries.

Since we were previously catching NotFound when that case occurred, we now have
to catch InstanceUpdateConflict to prevent the top-level cell to raise those
exceptions which can confuse the operator.

Change-Id: Ia03048b6cd0a68ada5f9f0b836fdc561d0a2fa67
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/73/218473/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: except (exception.NotFound, exception.InstanceUpdateConflict):

commit_message:
Trace on nova net-delete for neutron network

Problem is when try to delete a neutron network thorugh nova command, it is not working because it is not implemented.

Steps:
1. create neutron network.
    $ neutron net-create net3
2. delete it:
    $ nova tenant-network-delete net3

ERROR (ClientException): Unexpected API Error. Please report this at http://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/ and attach the Nova API log if possible.
<type 'exceptions.NotImplementedError'> (HTTP 500) (Request-ID: req-b4bfa5df-bed0-4bbd-ad89-e83e97b5df70)
Implemented delete network for neutronv2 in nova

Implemented delete method in neutronv2 api, by calling neutron client api.

And assumed that disassociate of network is not available in neutron network.

Unit test result:
$ neutron net-create test-net
Created a new network:
+-----------------------+--------------------------------------+
| Field                 | Value                                |
+-----------------------+--------------------------------------+
| admin_state_up        | True                                 |
| id                    | e0ea1569-d099-4a1b-9b85-df6b61ba3ced |
| mtu                   | 0                                    |
| name                  | test-net                             |
| port_security_enabled | True                                 |
| router:external       | False                                |
| shared                | False                                |
| status                | ACTIVE                               |
| subnets               |                                      |
| tenant_id             | 02f6d8b7662a45af9fae48c1df276a6d     |
+-----------------------+--------------------------------------+
$
$ nova net-list
+--------------------------------------+----------+------+
| ID                                   | Label    | CIDR |
+--------------------------------------+----------+------+
| 507cdddb-49a5-4dac-b806-4f56b4dda687 | private  | None |
| d97b27e5-bb93-4f10-8499-1ac67920c707 | uknet2   | None |
| e0b7725c-053b-472d-ab88-b11294cb01eb | public   | None |
| e0ea1569-d099-4a1b-9b85-df6b61ba3ced | test-net | None |
+--------------------------------------+----------+------+
$
$
$ nova tenant-network-delete e0ea1569-d099-4a1b-9b85-df6b61ba3ced
$
$ nova net-list
+--------------------------------------+---------+------+
| ID                                   | Label   | CIDR |
+--------------------------------------+---------+------+
| 507cdddb-49a5-4dac-b806-4f56b4dda687 | private | None |
| d97b27e5-bb93-4f10-8499-1ac67920c707 | uknet2  | None |
| e0b7725c-053b-472d-ab88-b11294cb01eb | public  | None |
+--------------------------------------+---------+------+
$

Change-Id: I3476265145cf55b0915545bf3d7a76d6a5f4fff9
Closes-Bug: #1504358

subject: Aggregate_metadata_get_by_host should only check provided key
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-13 23:23:35.000000000', 'files': ['nova/scheduler/filters/utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/90e12f375220ab7f3ee44b4af444f993e647856c', 'message': "Aggregate_metadata_get_by_host should only check provided key

Aggregate_metadata_get_by_host should only check provided key rather than
checking for the entire set for all keys. Doing so does not differentiate
it from the option where key is specified and where it is not. For
example in availability zone filter 'availability_zone' is passed as a key
explicitly whereas in aggregate_instance_extra_specs filter the key is not
specified. In its current state of art, the utility method
aggregate_metadata_get_by_host will scan all keys irrespective a
specific key has been specified or not. If a specific key is provided
all keys must not be scanned.

Change-Id: I806b18ce708cc71f81ea758e98164c5639776833
"}]
commit_message:
Aggregate_metadata_get_by_host should only check provided key

Aggregate_metadata_get_by_host should only check provided key rather than
checking for the entire set for all keys. Doing so does not differentiate
it from the option where key is specified and where it is not. For
example in availability zone filter 'availability_zone' is passed as a key
explicitly whereas in aggregate_instance_extra_specs filter the key is not
specified. In its current state of art, the utility method
aggregate_metadata_get_by_host will scan all keys irrespective a
specific key has been specified or not. If a specific key is provided
all keys must not be scanned.

Change-Id: I806b18ce708cc71f81ea758e98164c5639776833

commit_message:
Enable gnocchi systemd services

Marian Krcmari noticed that on a freshly deployed HA Newton system
gnocchi-metricd and gnocchi-statsd are down. This likely came about when
gnocchi moved to composable roles
(I40a3815923099d00a0f3fc1d88a942784e7c6fb9) and those settings made
sense when it was managed by pacemaker.

Also make sure that all services are disabled when managed via
pacemaker and add manage_service: false for gnocchi-api for pacemaker
which was missing.

Change-Id: If7d681e0fa3e84379ac83c8a55b481369fe2849e

commit_message:
Check a local disk exists

Provide a check for missing local disk files before checking
their size. This will make it more obvious that a disk file has
gone missing.

Change-Id: I4d0ecda1a709649ffbc64ccbdcd48f85729cebd9
Partial-Bug: #1522667

commit_message:
Stop eating up SDaemonError in kill_all and shutdown_all

Prevously, we ignore any SDaemonError which happens when
killing/shutdowning all storlet daemons.
This patch makes these functions re-raise SDaemonError, to
enable us to detect the bug situation which causes these
exceptions.

bonus:
This patch also includes fixes about the usage of assertRaises,
and also introcudes assertRaisesRegexp for more clean assertion
about exception messages.

Change-Id: I1af681729ac0a66fd76d0ee3d6e80bc7669566f4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/storlets refs/changes/59/359959/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: raise SDaemonError('Failed to send kill signal to {0}' .format(storlet_name)) def process_kill_all(self, try_all=True): :param try_all: wheather we try to kill all process if we fail to stop some of the storlet daemons failed = [] self.logger.exception('Failed to stop one storlet daemon {0}' .format(storlet_name)) if try_all: failed.append(storlet_name) else: raise if failed: names = ', '.join(failed) raise SDaemonError('Failed to stop some storlet daemons: {0}' .format(names)) def shutdown_all_processes(self, try_all=True): :param try_all: wheather we try to kill all process if we fail to stop some of the storlet daemons :raises SDaemonError: when failed to kill one of the storlet daemons failed = [] self.logger.exception('Failed to shutdown storlet daemon %s' % if try_all: failed.append(storlet_name) else: raise if failed: names = ', '.join(failed) raise SDaemonError('Failed to shutdown some storlet daemons: {0}' .format(names)) else: self.logger.info('All the storlet daemons are terminated') return terminated try: self.process_kill_all() return CommandSuccess('OK', False) except SDaemonError as e: self.logger.exception('Failed to stop some storlet daemons') return CommandFailure(str(e), False) try: terminated = self.shutdown_all_processes() msg = '; '.join(['%s: terminated' % x for x in terminated]) return CommandSuccess(msg, False) except SDaemonError as e: self.logger.exception('Failed to halt some storlet daemons') return CommandFailure(str(e), False)
deleted_lines: raise SDaemonError('Failed to send kill signal to {0}') def process_kill_all(self): # TODO(takashi): Can we really pass here? pass def shutdown_all_processes(self): self.logger.exception('Failed to shutdown sdaemon %s' % pass self.logger.info('All the storlet daemons are terminated') return terminated self.process_kill_all() return CommandSuccess('OK', False) terminated = self.shutdown_all_processes() msg = '; '.join(['%s: terminated' % x for x in terminated]) return CommandSuccess(msg, False)

commit_message:
Role cleanup/changes for newton OSA

- The database create and user creates have been removed from the
  role. These tasks have been relocated to the playbook.

- Tags cleanup.

- The "Attempt venv download" task now uses the "checksum" parameter
  from the get_url module to check if it is necessary to download
  the venv.

- The playbook and its variables (on extras folder) have been updated
  to reflect these chages.

Change-Id: If15f32d51a4f0265322abbcf25d96ba5c77fe1a6

commit_message:
Add a test Scenario for uwsgi & nginx

New func_uwsgi-nginx test scenario that will test keystone installed
with uwsgi behind nginx.
This will start off as experimental but can be used to test the final
nginx solution as it is finalised.

Change-Id: Id5ec7b1895b51232aacf1c86e564563de6c21d3f

commit_message:
[db] Instances named invalid regexp string can't been deleted

Users boot instance with special characters like "vm_(". When try to
show or delete the instance. Query will just pass filter value as regexp
pattern. Therefore users try to find instance with 'vm_(' in db will
raise "Got error 'parentheses not balanced' from regexp". In same case,
if users use 'vm_[' will "got Got error 'brackets ([ ]) not balanced'
from regexp".

These issues were occured when users create instances, which name are
invalid regular expression format. We should escape fitler values which
are invalid regexp string.

Change-Id: I15f5d6c89dbd4cee6c297b2b793d31cc92c178a0
closes-Bug: 1524044

commit_message:
Remove one instance of mox from unit/objects/test_instance.py

This instance of mox was significantly different, and involved than the
others, so fixed it (used 'mock' instead) in this patch separately

Part of bp:remove-mox

Change-Id: I9e63da7a6ad0a839538d2b471ee70960e2534134

commit_message:
Add soft reboot support to ironic driver.

This patch introduces a new power state "SOFT_REBOOT" to ironic driver,
and make reboot() be able to handle soft and hard reboot.

Change-Id: Ibd07ff510ca84db46b685315582dd9ed19726bbb
Implements: blueprint soft-reboot-poweroff
Related-to: blueprint enhance-power-interface-for-soft-reboot-and-nmi
Co-Authored-By: Tang Chen <chen.tang@easystack.cn>

subject: [libvirt] Attaching volume to paused instance error is not clear
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-02 03:55:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/7acbded42c299a4906f1759dcd181c142caf0e9f', 'message': "[libvirt] Attaching volume to paused instance error is not clear

If we try to detaching disk from paused instance, device will still in
use until instance was been unpaused. It is same even we detach disk
with live option. When users try to attach available volume libvirt will
raise exception. Log will only recored with device is in use and device
is buzy. Users will probably felt confuse.

We can specify other device name, but it is not hourned in
libvirt. Maybe we can just notify users when they try to attach disk to
exist device in paused instance. Besides this situation didn't need to
connect volume.

Change-Id: I436149e194713a714701ca4d37138faab67ce6fa
Closes-Bug: 1427732

commit_message:
[libvirt] Attaching volume to paused instance error is not clear

If we try to detaching disk from paused instance, device will still in
use until instance was been unpaused. It is same even we detach disk
with live option. When users try to attach available volume libvirt will
raise exception. Log will only recored with device is in use and device
is buzy. Users will probably felt confuse.

We can specify other device name, but it is not hourned in
libvirt. Maybe we can just notify users when they try to attach disk to
exist device in paused instance. Besides this situation didn't need to
connect volume.

Change-Id: I436149e194713a714701ca4d37138faab67ce6fa
Closes-Bug: 1427732

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary headers in xen plugin

During image upload in Xen plugin several
useless headers are passed to Glance server.
They can be omitted.

Change-Id: I5836e45965514bf295e49e78f2cfd341b3e1acbb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/52/271252/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: # NOTE(sirp): There is some confusion around OVF. Here's a summary # of where we currently stand: # 1. OVF as a container format is misnamed. We really should be # using OVA since that is the name for the container format; # OVF is the standard applied to the manifest file contained # within. # 2. We're currently uploading a vanilla tarball. In order to be # OVF/OVA compliant, we'll need to embed a minimal OVF # manifest as the first file. # NOTE(dprince): In order to preserve existing Glance properties # we set X-Glance-Registry-Purge-Props on this request. 'x-image-meta-is-public': 'False', 'x-image-meta-status': 'queued', 'x-image-meta-disk-format': 'vhd', 'x-image-meta-container-format': 'ovf', 'x-glance-registry-purge-props': 'False'} headers.update(**extra_headers)

commit_message:
db_api: add multi sort interface into db api

Add an interface to get all flavors that match all filters sorted
by multiple keys.

Change-Id: Ic6ecd378460ddc12a77e56ecc1938249866d5631
Implements: blueprint multi-sort-keys-and-directions-support
Partial-bug: #1546102

= {'name': '%a%'} sort_keys = ['name'] sort_dirs = ['asc'] expect_order = [flavor_f1, flavor_f2, flavor_f3, flavor_f4, flavor_f5, flavor_f6] self._assert_eqauls_flavors_order(expect_order, filters,
